content:
I recently tried the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment and found it to be quite thick and greasy. It feels very heavy and sticky on the skin, which was not ideal for my older, mature skin and caused breakouts. The color correction feature primarily comes from the green tint titanium dioxide, which casts a white shadow on your face. Essentially, it‚Äôs a titanium dioxide sunscreen with added botanicals. Save your money and buy straight titanium dioxide and mix it with a green color corrector.
For the price point, it‚Äôs too expensive given the small quantity and the benefits it claims to deliver. However, it is a good sunscreen and does have a pleasant scent. Overall, it just wasn‚Äôt the right fit for me.

This CC cream does an excellent job of neutralizing redness and evening out my skin tone. The tiger grass (centella asiatica) is soothing and helps calm any irritation or inflammation on my skin.

Overall, this product has become a staple in my skincare routine. If you're looking for a color-correcting treatment that also offers skincare benefits, I highly recommend giving this one a try!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024
content:
I have veryyy sensitive and red skin (I‚Äôm talking people used point out how red I was daily). This product has been a life saver! Most foundations I‚Äôve tried end up being too cakey or just don‚Äôt match my tone well enough and look unnatural.
This essentially takes the place of any foundation in my morning routine. I put it on shortly after moisturizing and it blends to look very natural. It feels like nothing on my skin and actually sets in pretty well to hold up good against sweat at times. I have found that it lasts usually all day without much issue (8 am - 10 pm for me), but can occasionally get dry spots. I have acne prone skin and have noticed small breakouts that could be from this product, but they are usually rare and could just be from something else in my routine.

Some tips:
Be careful not to put too much as it can make you too pale, I usually layer a little concealer on after and it helps even out the tone as well. Be aware that I would only recommend this to very pale skinned people, anyone with a little tint to their skin might find this looking VERY pale on them.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
content:
I have very pale skin and my entire face is an uneven skin tone (red). Here‚Äôs my thoughts and suggestions:

-It covers redness well but if you‚Äôre having a bad acne day, don‚Äôt depend on this entirely. You may need to partner it with concealer.
-Make sure your skin is hydrated before applying.
-You can use a damp beauty blender to apply.
-A little goes a long way.
-I apply moisturizer first, then the cream. If you‚Äôre feeling fancy, you can still powder your face and apply bronzer, blush, and highlighter.
-I don‚Äôt recommend using LIQUID bronzer/blush/highlighter on top of the cream. The cream will lift off when you try to blend them together.
-It covers freckles well, too. I like to take a q-tip and uncover mine, so that‚Äôs why you see them in my photo.
-It literally lasts the entire day. ALL DAY!
-I like to apply MAC fix it setting spray after I apply the cream and powder my face because it ‚Äúmelts‚Äù the cream, evens it out, and gives you a more healthy, natural look. It‚Äôs the only setting spray I‚Äôve used that does this. Without it the cream you might look dry and patchy, even if you applied moisturizer first.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2024
content: The first time I bought this, I was hesitant because of the price and not sure if I wanted to spend the money only to find out I didn‚Äôt like it. But now, almost two years later, I‚Äôve found I use it more often than not! I have Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome and my face flushes bright red very easily, especially after a long day of work, so I like wearing something to hide the red. I was a foundation user for a long time but since I‚Äôve started using this, I‚Äôve gradually stopped using foundation completely. I find that it sits and lasts better than even my favorite foundation. It took me a little while to find the right amount to use because if you use too much, it‚Äôs definitely not the right color. But this is truly a little-goes-a-long-way product and it corrects my redness just enough to look natural. I usually apply it after doing a full skincare routine because it sits best on moisturized skin. Because you truly don‚Äôt need a lot, it ends up being a very cost effective product in the long run. I bought my first bottle in December 2022 and now I can‚Äôt go back. I went for a smaller bottle this time just because of how long it lasts. I‚Äôll wear it either on its own or sometimes I‚Äôll put a light layer of powder on top to seal it, but with just a little bit of product it stays well for hours and looks very natural, at least in my case! Even if my skin isn‚Äôt flushed, I‚Äôll use it to spot certain areas to even everything out. Great to have on hand and I never travel without it.

I've always HATES foundation and this seems like a great alternative plus it has SPF. It

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024
content:
I have veryyy sensitive and red skin (I‚Äôm talking people used point out how red I was daily). This product has been a life saver! Most foundations I‚Äôve tried end up being too cakey or just don‚Äôt match my tone well enough and look unnatural.
This essentially takes the place of any foundation in my morning routine. I put it on shortly after moisturizing and it blends to look very natural. It feels like nothing on my skin and actually sets in pretty well to hold up good against sweat at times. I have found that it lasts usually all day without much issue (8 am - 10 pm for me), but can occasionally get dry spots. I have acne prone skin and have noticed small breakouts that could be from this product, but they are usually rare and could just be from something else in my routine.

Some tips:
Be careful not to put too much as it can make you too pale, I usually layer a little concealer on after and it helps even out the tone as well. Be aware that I would only recommend this to very pale skinned people, anyone with a little tint to their skin might find this looking VERY pale on them.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
content:
I have very pale skin and my entire face is an uneven skin tone (red). Here‚Äôs my thoughts and suggestions:

-It covers redness well but if you‚Äôre having a bad acne day, don‚Äôt depend on this entirely. You may need to partner it with concealer.
-Make sure your skin is hydrated before applying.
-You can use a damp beauty blender to apply.
-A little goes a long way.
-I apply moisturizer first, then the cream. If you‚Äôre feeling fancy, you can still powder your face and apply bronzer, blush, and highlighter.
-I don‚Äôt recommend using LIQUID bronzer/blush/highlighter on top of the cream. The cream will lift off when you try to blend them together.
-It covers freckles well, too. I like to take a q-tip and uncover mine, so that‚Äôs why you see them in my photo.
-It literally lasts the entire day. ALL DAY!
-I like to apply MAC fix it setting spray after I apply the cream and powder my face because it ‚Äúmelts‚Äù the cream, evens it out, and gives you a more healthy, natural look. It‚Äôs the only setting spray I‚Äôve used that does this. Without it the cream you might look dry and patchy, even if you applied moisturizer first.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment SPF 30 | cc cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2024
content: The first time I bought this, I was hesitant because of the price and not sure if I wanted to spend the money only to find out I didn‚Äôt like it. But now, almost two years later, I‚Äôve found I use it more often than not! I have Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome and my face flushes bright red very easily, especially after a long day of work, so I like wearing something to hide the red. I was a foundation user for a long time but since I‚Äôve started using this, I‚Äôve gradually stopped using foundation completely. I find that it sits and lasts better than even my favorite foundation. It took me a little while to find the right amount to use because if you use too much, it‚Äôs definitely not the right color. But this is truly a little-goes-a-long-way product and it corrects my redness just enough to look natural. I usually apply it after doing a full skincare routine because it sits best on moisturized skin. Because you truly don‚Äôt need a lot, it ends up being a very cost effective product in the long run. I bought my first bottle in December 2022 and now I can‚Äôt go back. I went for a smaller bottle this time just because of how long it lasts. I‚Äôll wear it either on its own or sometimes I‚Äôll put a light layer of powder on top to seal it, but with just a little bit of product it stays well for hours and looks very natural, at least in my case! Even if my skin isn‚Äôt flushed, I‚Äôll use it to spot certain areas to even everything out. Great to have on hand and I never travel without it.

It might‚Äôve taken the edge off the look of the redness, but it definitely doesn‚Äôt have enough green pigment to camouflage. I do like that it has 30SPF sunscreen in it and it does moisturize very well and I know it‚Äôs got great ingredients in it, so I will keep it and use it as extra protection for my cheeks where I have a lot of redness and scars that are still red from breakouts. I am glad I got the small size which is plenty. I think it will help protect my redness and red scars even more since it‚Äôs got SPF and I already use two other SPF products.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
content: I normally love Dr. Jart products since they're perfect for sensitive rosacea-prone skin, but not sure about this one. It's a pretty cool kind of mask, completely different from the usual drippy serum slathered thin cotton sheet masks. There's a foil packet with white goopy serum that I first dabbed all over my face, then spread out evenly with clean hands - it's not drippy at all, it's a very solid viscous goop lol. Then there's another sheet mask packet that has the rubber mask in it that was wet with another serum. The rubber mask kinda smells like the slimes that kids like to play with and the feel of it was like like thin and soft gelatin. There was already two small punctures in it just from taking it out of the packet and plastic sheet folded around it, so definitely very fragile. It felt very cool to the touch but quickly went away as my skin warmed it up. Chilled out for about 45 min and it got very cool again towards the last 15 minutes. However, once I took it off, there was still visible goo on my face. I tried rubbing it in and adding a moisturizer on top to seal it in, but it all just congealed into a sticky tacky residue that I couldn't stand after 20 minutes. I ended up rinsing off my face with water before applying my usual light and heavy moisturizers.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content: I've heard many positive things about the Dr.Jart+ face mask series after seeing them in Sephora and I gotta say the overall experience was positive and left my face feeling nourished and hydrated. Unlike standard face mask the Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask is two steps that has an ampoule that's a vitamin C serum. Unlike regular face mask where you apply for 20 minutes, this one recommends 30-40 mins in order to let the serum soak into your skin and really get the effects working. Before I apply the mask I do apply my toner to help with absorption. Following the sheet mask and waking up the next morning my skin was glowing and brighter (the shade was less dull than the night before). If you're looking for an elevated sheet mask this is your sign.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

I‚Äôm not going to lie - the mask is two pieces and they do slip a little bit while you‚Äôre wearing it but you can easily readjust. The end result is a glowing complexion. title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content:
Things I like about this mask:
- It feels very cold and refreshing
- It's been a half hour since taking it off, and my face still feels cool
- Once it finally all absorbed, my skin felt soft

Things I don't like about it:
- The instructions seem to say to use the entire gel pack all in one use, yet there is far too much for it to absorb into the skin. I had to wipe off most of it, instead of rubbing the excess in like the directions say.
- As far as I can tell, there's only one use per packet, yet the instructions say to use it about 3 times per week.
- My skin felt a bit itchy while using the mask.

This did leave my face feeling soft and refreshed, but I wouldn't want to use it regularly, because it's messy and wasteful if there's only one use per packet.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content:
This Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Brightening Face Mask is a really interesting face mask! I‚Äôve never tried anything like this before. You are to apply the included ampoule and smooth the serum over your face and then apply the mask to help seal the serum into the skin.

This takes 40 minutes - yes, FORTY MINUTES!! I‚Äôm lucky if I can find 4 minutes for a face mask (toddler mom, IYKYK haha). So, it‚Äôs a long one!!

It also is only one application. For the price (16 at time of review) and then recommending to use 3 times a week .. ehhh‚Ä¶.

I do have fairly sensitive skin and my skin just did not love it. I did NOT leave it on for the full 40 minutes, thankfully. Only about 20 minutes. But I think it was too thick for my skin. Made me gets bumps all over the next morning. So sensitive skin peeps, maybe do a spot test with a little of the included serum prior to using the full mask on your whole face‚Ä¶

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
content:
If you have some extra time (about 40+ minutes) this is a great mask to use. I used the moisture mask (blue) and it gave my skin a nice boost of moisture and cooling. My face has been a little red lately because it has been really hot, this felt nice for my skin. It definitely cooled down my face. It does have a cooling sensation but not in a minty, menthol way, which is good because I'm not a fan of that. It had that cooling sensation in the beginning but starts to wear off after 10 minutes. I did also feel a tingling sensation, which I assume is just the serum working. The tingling sensation also went away after 15-20 minutes.

I was working on my laptop so I used this sitting up. The mask did slip down a little bit but surprisingly not as much as I thought it would. Don't touch or play with it too much otherwise it will start sliding down and falling off even more. The small packet of serum was just the right amount to cover my entire face. The rubber part was a bit too small to cover my entire face or perhaps I placed it incorrectly but I remember wishing it was a bit larger so it would cover more towards my forehead. I have a small face so I'm actually surprised, but like I said I probably placed it incorrectly. The rubber part of the mask helps the serum stay and soak into the skin. It was comfortable to wear. Handle the rubber portion with care because it will tear if you put too much force on it.

Once I removed the mask there was a lot of serum still visible on my face. I didn't try to rub it in, I just let it air dry. It does leave my face looking a bit greasy/dewy but I'm fine with it because I usually use masks at night before bed. My face definitely felt very moisturized and soft. I like Dr Jart masks but they are slightly pricier, although not ridiculous. Going forward I'll probably get more of these. As a busy mom of a toddler I don't always have the time to lay down and do a mask for 30-40 minutes but at least this one does work while I'm sitting up, although expect a little bit of slipping and sliding as well. Give this a try if your skin needs a major moisture boost and cooling down. This is one pack which means it is one use only. Made in Korea.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
content: This face mask is a total must-have for any spa night. It‚Äôs a bit price but is worth it. The serum is super creamy and thick, feeling luxurious. The rubber mask is like a jelly-like delight that keeps all the product in place, so I don‚Äôt have to worry about it drying out. Plus, I get to enjoy the mask for a longer period of time, which means I‚Äôm getting the most out of this.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
content: Dr.Jart premium mask with Hyaluronic Acid serum. It‚Äôs a one time use, 2 step mask. The hyaluronic acid serum is dense and thick, it has a gel cream consistency. There was enough serum to cover my face and lips. The thick gel rubber appears to seal in the serum. The mask is thick but I had to be careful not to cut through it with my nails. The mask sticks on my face for 25 mins although the bottom edges did start to fall off towards about the 20 min mark. My skin is on the dry side. After the use of my mask my skin felt refreshed and moisturized, it‚Äôs a nice mask! Made in Korea.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
content:
This made my skin feel brand new and made my skin look so fresh, clean and glass skin! I know the mask has to be left on for quite awhile but it was perfect for my late night movie! I loved it and it felt great while doing the mask and the hydraulic acid felt great!! I loved it and for the price you're getting really great ingredients in your skincare. It does recommend doing it a bit more than what I'd say you really need to do but I think once or twice a month would be better. My skin really looked and felt amazing. it was glowing and smooth and soft. I recommend!!

Edit
I saw some reviews talking about how the mask itself isn't great or they don't like that step. The point of the "rubber" mask is to help the product soak into the skin deeper and penetrate it better. It isn't to just look funny or an unnecessary step. The mask itself also is made of sea moss and can be washed and reused with other products. That is one of my favorite parts of the mask!!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content: I'm not the audience for this product. 30 minutes with goo on my face is just too long. And it took about another 15 minutes for the goo to not be sticky/tacky. The mask slide down over my lips a lot. I had to keep readjusting it. Somewhere around 20 minutes in I had a sneezing attack so I had to remove the rubber part (try blowing your nose in that!) I will say that the next day my face felt nice and soft. I can see doing this for a spa day, but not the 2 or 3 times a week that the package suggests.

Probably not, but if the serum is cheap enough to buy then maybe a different story...

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content:
This was an interesting mask to try. First, I wasn't expecting to have to leave this on for 30-40 minutes (which is a long time because I couldn't move around too much or the mask would easily slide off) or that it's recommended to use this 2-3x a week (neither of those are mentioned in the listing but is on the back of the box) but I did like the end results. My skin was very hydrated afterwards & it did feel cool while I was using it but nothing else stood out in comparison to other masks that are quicker, easier and/or less expensive to use.
So while this was nice to use once, I wouldn't use this as a weekly regime because it's too time consuming and costly to use.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content:
I recently ordered the Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid and was blown away by how great it works!!
I've struggled with dry, combination skin, with cystic acne and scarring for 30 years, so I've used everything out there. In one application, I saw an immediate difference! My skin was softer and brighter in appearance! It was also very hydrating and I had fun applying this mask.

Overall, I'm very happy with the results! The texture of the mask itself is different than other masks out there, but ingredients seem very high quality. If you're looking to try something new, I would definitely recommend this Dr.JART+ mask!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content: This is one of those masks that I might recommend trying if you have an event or something you want to do something special before, but I otherwise can't imagine incorporating it into my skincare routine at the price point. It is nice and cooling and was very nice in that regard but there wasn't really any extraordinary improvement in my skin that I don't see with much cheaper face masks. I love dr jart sheet masks and this one is by far their most expensive, without actually providing much improvement over their cheaper ones. My skin was definitely more glowy and even-toned, but it typically is when I use their masks and the effects were gone by the next day. It definitely hydrates and allows more product to absorb, but the price really isn't justified for performance. I'd recommend their other (less expensive) masks over this one.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2024
content:
Fun experience for an every once in a while treat, but MAN are these expensive.

I washed my face, applied toner, then applied the serum, then popped on the mask. It slipped a little more than the turquoise cryo rubber mask that I tried last week, but it stayed on through doing dishes for the most part.

After I removed it I waited 10 minutes and applied moisturizer, my skin was hydrated for the rest of the day, but I certainly wasn't WOWed, I feel like at this pricepoint a mask should wow me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content: This was an interesting concept because it's quite different from the typical facial mask. The packaging included a serum and a rubber mask. I first applied the serum, then the rubber mask, and left it on for 20 minutes. It felt great on my skin because it was 80 degrees, and the mask was chilly on my face. After removing it, it left my face moisturized and fresh. The rubber itself teared pretty easily though and didn't stick to my face so it took a while to adjust it properly but that ended up leaving a few holes throughout the mask.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
content: This mask is different and interesting, it's a rubber mask, not reusable silicone or soft bamboo ones. I don't like that it's single use though and seems more wasteful than other types of masks. Plus, this is very expensive while the benefits are similar to cheaper masks.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024

It is a heftier cost for a single use face mark so maybe just a treat when needed.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
content: My face has been looking extra dull and dry after dealing with this insane heat this summer and getting so much sun. Even wearing sunscreen my face still feels like the life is being sucked out and dehydrated with so many spots. The cooling effect was soothing, I was surprised by how my skin glowed. I have senstive skin and I tired a new product and it gave me a slight rash. After this mask my redness diminished and it made my skin a bit smoother, while it didn't even out my skin completely I did see a noticeable difference that lasted for a period of 3 days. The mask itself is also very cool to the touch and feels really refreshing on the skin. I love that it comes in two parts and you can stretch it to fit your face perfectly. I've seen complaints that the mask rips easily but I only experienced that when my nails pierced it. It is a bit delicate so work carefully and patiently to stretch it. Otherwise, I didn't have any issues applying it. I also didn't experience it sliding down my face and I was able to walk around my apartment with it on for the 30 minutes. After, my skin felt so smooth and hydrated!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Face Mask with Moisturizing Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content:
This was definitely interesting! You first use the little packet which is a creamy white consistency like lotion. You get surprisingly a lot in the packet so make sure you spread it evenly. The mask is folded up inside the bigger packaging in two separate pieces. Be gentle with the mask because it rips very easily. I poked a whole in my forehead and chin just from touching it with my nails and trying to put it back in place. It‚Äôs going to work best if you‚Äôre laying down or at an angle, because there‚Äôs so much liquid that it slides down your face when you‚Äôre using it. One random thing that I appreciated is that the mask packaging is paper/foil so when your hands are slimy from the hylauranic acid, you can still easily open the mask.

Korean skincare is awesome, and I could definitely tell my face was more moisturized and soft after using it and even the next day.

Now it says you should use one of these every 2-3 days but at $20 a piece that‚Äôs going to be pretty expensive. I do think this is a good monthly mask though to refresh your face.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
content:
The mask is made from ultra-fine microfiber, which allows it to adhere closely to the skin, ensuring that the serum is evenly distributed. The mask is slightly on the thinner side, which makes it feel light and comfortable on the skin. However, this does mean that it can be a bit tricky to unfold without tearing if you're not careful.

**Formula & Performance:**
Infused with a powerful blend of niacinamide, glutathione, and a variety of plant extracts, the mask targets dullness and uneven skin tone effectively. After a 15-20 minute application, the skin feels instantly hydrated and looks visibly brighter. The serum absorbs quickly without leaving a sticky residue, which is a plus for those who prefer not to rinse off after using sheet masks.

**Results:**
The brightening effect is noticeable immediately after use, with a more even skin tone and a healthy glow. While the results are not permanent, regular use of this mask can help maintain a luminous complexion. It's particularly useful before special occasions when you need a quick skin pick-me-up.

**Pros:**
- Instantly brightens and evens out skin tone
- Hydrates the skin deeply
- Non-sticky formula
- Fits well and feels comfortable on the skin

**Cons:**
- The thin material can tear if not handled gently
- The brightening effect is temporary and needs regular use for sustained results

The brightening effect is noticeable immediately after use, with a more even skin tone and a healthy glow. While the results are not permanent, regular use of this mask can help maintain a luminous complexion. It's particularly useful before special occasions when you need a quick skin pick-me-up.

**Pros:**
- Instantly brightens and evens out skin tone
- Hydrates the skin deeply
- Non-sticky formula
- Fits well and feels comfortable on the skin

**Cons:**
- The thin material can tear if not handled gently
- The brightening effect is temporary and needs regular use for sustained results

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content:
This arrives really nicely sealed. Just pull across the notches at the top to access the packet. Love how hygienic this is!

Now, this has a mesh, plastic backer. Unfold and pull this off before applying. You will be impressed that this isn't the typical thin serum. Instead this is a thicker cream. This is the first mask I have ever tried that is like this!

This applies easily, absolutely does not drip, and does not sting or burn in any way. I wore this for over twenty minutes. When I removed it, I really rubbed the leftover serum into my neck and the backs of my hands. Do not rinse, but allow this to just continue to work on your skin.

I was really impressed with how luminous my skin looked the next morning. So smooth!

I really like this mask and the results it delivers! Recommended!

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: This feels good on my face, I left it on 10 minutes. Seemed to brighten it a bit. But only ONE mask! Very pricey.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
content: I'm usually pretty annoyed by masks that tear and while this one did a little, I also found that the mask itself had great results so I'm going to warn that it may tear but not take off any rating due to it still being worth it, especially if you're really careful with it so it doesn't tear. After using this mask and applying the remaining serum (plenty for face, neck, and chest!), I definitely did notice a brightening effect immediately. My skin can sometimes be sensitive and this did not cause any negative reaction for me. The brightening effects only last maybe a day so you would need to incorporate this into your routine or just have it on hand for days where you want your skin to look extra nice. I'd definitely recommend for the latter use, as using it consistently would add up in price but only using for special occasions is much more reasonable!

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024
content:
The first thing I noticed is that the pouch has a lot of liquid ‚Äî more than enough! After applying the mask to my face, I had plenty left over to use on my neck and chest, with some to spare.

The mask itself fit my face really well. The cutouts for the eyes and mouth were just right, unlike some other masks that never seem to fit properly.

As for results, I can't say I saw a dramatic difference in my skin after one use, but it was a nice treat to pamper myself. All in all, it‚Äôs a nice little luxury if you‚Äôre looking to spoil yourself!

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2024
content: At first I found this mask to be a bit on the pricey side. It‚Äôs around $10 for one sheet when I selected it. When I took the mask out I was surprised to see that it was loaded with lots of the serum. The mask itself is large and quite a thick material. It fit my face well around the eyes and nose, but it did overlap a bit on to my hair. No biggie tho. The product is nice and didn‚Äôt cause any irritation. I left it on for about 15 minutes. Since there is so much juice, I was able to apply some on my neck and hands. It does take some time for it to absorb into the skin. It did leave my skin moisturized and soft.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2024
content: I‚Äôve used this face mask a couple of times, and it‚Äôs become one of my go-to sheet masks. After using it, my skin feels refreshed and looks noticeably brighter. The mask itself fits well, and it‚Äôs soaked in enough serum to cover my face without feeling too drippy or messy.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2024
content:
This mask comes with a thick plastic mesh that sits between the top and bottom when folded in half, and it makes it very easy to unfold. The mask is the thickest fabric mask I've used (and I've tried over 20 brands), and felt warm despite me leaving it in the fridge. I like that the fit is quite good, the holes for the eyes, nose, and mouth fit well for me, though it doesn't go up high enough on my forehead. I just used some extra serum there. The serum itself is a milky substance that seems thick, though I'm not sure if that's because it was in the fridge or not. I was a bit annoyed the mask kept lifting from my chin under my lip, but it didn't lift anywhere else at all. Though it felt warm, the serum and mask against my face ere very soft feeling and nice, and I didn't notice any stinging or tingling at all.

I kept it on for the full 20 minutes and there was plenty of serum left to pat in. It took another 20 minutes for it absorb/dry, and it left my face feeling super soft and moisturized, if a tiny bit tacky. I didn't notice any brightening in one use, but do like how well this moisturizes and how nice the serum itself feels.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
content: It's a great face mask, for sure. I don't know how much it being a good face mask justifies the cost though.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024
content:
The mask is huge- more like a face blanket than most sheet masks. They also didn‚Äôt skimp on the serum- you can use the leftovers on any of the rough areas on your skin like I did- especially my elbows and knees!

My skin felt hydrated but I didn‚Äôt really notice any brightening. I‚Äôm in my 40s, grew up in high altitude mountains during my formative years and played so much soccer. I‚Äôve got melasma, freckles, moles- and didn‚Äôt really think this was going to brighten my old lady face.

Price-wise, it's a bit of a splurge. I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôd splurge again or just put the money towards another product like glycolic acid.

Feels nice, pricey.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Intra Jet Wrinkless Solution Face Mask with Glycerin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content: Who knew that dry skin could give you wrinkles? As someone with extremely dry skin, I know that it is extremely important for me to keep my skin moisturized. Though I don't have any deep wrinkles, I do have some tiny forehead wrinkles and fine smile lines. Immediately after using this mask, I did notice those fine lines were a lot less noticeable, almost nonexistent anymore! There is a slight tightening effect that I feel on my skin after the mask dried off so I assume that is the wrinkless part of this mask. I find this mask is not as moisturizing as their other masks but at least it does what it's advertised to do, which is help you get rid/tighten your wrinkles haha :)

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Intra Jet Wrinkless Solution Face Mask with Glycerin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

The ceramide moisture mask (yellow packaging) is the same price, and I feel like it had better results - and it stayed on my face better AND only needs to be worn for 20 minutes, so I recommend that one instead.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Intra Jet Wrinkless Solution Face Mask with Glycerin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

I have very sensitive skin and have had bad reactions to many products, but this mask is particularly gentle, and just as advertised, wonderful for my middle aged overworked skin. title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Intra Jet Wrinkless Solution Face Mask with Glycerin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content:

So, first, this arrives nicely sealed but is also easy to open (just tear at the premade notches). Now, this is a two-part gel mask. Each part has double backers (one on front and one on back) So, take your time to peel those off. Apply the top and bottom mask and slide them into the perfect place. Once they are positioned, they stay. And, there is not one ounce of dripping!

I left this on until it was virtually dry. And, when I removed the two parts, my skin looked stunning! Well worth the time and investment.

Thus far, my overall impression of Dr. Jart products is beyond positive! And, this mask is no exception! Love it!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
content:
This was the first Dr. Jart mask I've ever tried, and it was such a neat experience! I love that the ampoule comes separate from the rubbery mask, because it always annoyed me how in the pre-soaked masks, 50% of the serum got left behind in the packet.

This mask really is COOLING. It feels amazing! You will look ridiculous with it on, but isn't that half the fun? I have pale, very reactive/dramatic skin, so I have to be cautious about what I use for skincare. I have some psoriasis on my face as well, and am prone to periorbital dermatitis. This did not cause any sensitivity issues, irritation or flare ups.

My skin was left feeling really refreshed, calm, soothed, etc. And I noticed a decrease in redness/reactivity of my skin for a few days afterwards, and my skin just seeemed happier, plumper and more even.

I really enjoyed using this mask, although I do believe it is a bit on the pricey side. I really did see results, though, so that puts it far ahead 98% of the other face masks I have tried- so I do think I would get this again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content:
These masks are SO expensive. I didn't think it could possibly be worth the price, but WOWOW worth it.

Easy to use, tear open the serum pack, pat it on your face (there's a LOT of serum, I put it on my neck too), tear open the mask pack, put the top one on first, then the bottom, set a timer for 40 minutes, and go about your day. I did housework, and painted while I waited, it didn't slip or move from my face at all (yay! most Dr Jart masks stay put, but not all, happy that this one stayed). When the timer was up, I took off the mask, tossed it, waited 10 minutes, then put on a light moisturizer (Wander Beauty Dive In). My skin felt moisturized and hydrated ALL DAY. I know that "soothing and cooling" are the two claims of this mask, and it definitely feels soothing and cooling, but I don't really *need* either of those, what I need is a mask that leaves my dehydrated, unhappy skin feeling moisturized and happy, and this did it for me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: I tried this face mask and found it to be a refreshing and effective solution for calming sensitive skin. The mask comes in two steps: a soothing ampoule and a rubber mask that molds to the contours of the face. The ampoule contains beneficial ingredients that help reduce redness and irritation, while the rubber mask seals in moisture and enhances absorption. After using it, my skin felt noticeably softer and more relaxed. The cooling sensation of the mask added to the overall soothing experience. This product is ideal for anyone looking to pamper their skin with a luxurious and calming treatment.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

Unlike regular face mask where you apply for 20 minutes, this one recommends 30-40 mins in order to let the serum soak into your skin and really get the effects working. Before I apply the mask I do apply my toner to help with absorption. Following the sheet mask and waking up the next morning my skin was glowing and brighter (the shade was less dull than the night before). If you're looking for an elevated sheet mask this is your sign.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024
content: Dr. Jart is well known for their skincare and masks. In the past, I've used a few of their creams and masks but didn't try this rubber kind yet. It is certainly pricey but if you think about a facial, it is still way more affordable. I like how the product is in a separate step from the mask. Typically when they are together, you have a lot of product wasted in the package / it can start to dry out and evaporate. The ampoule potion is very soothing and rich. Once you apply the mask, you can do what you normally do, but just more carefully. I was able to drink my tea and that is not something I can usually do with the white clothlike masks that you typically get. The mask did start to kind of fall off my face but taking both pieces off and doing the bottom one first was the key to making it stay again. It seems you can reuse the mask a few times, so I plan to use my own serums and then putting the rubber mask over it a few times before I toss this.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cryo Rubber Soothing Face Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
content:
As someone with red, dry, and sensitive skin, I found this mask helped my skin's hydration improve tremendously! It did not cause any irritation on my skin. The face mask itself is made of rubber and because of the fact that it's made of rubber, there's a cooling sensation when it sits on your face. It's super refreshing and feels so nice to use during the summer!

Immediately after using this mask, I noticed the redness on my face improved a ton and my skin definitely looked more plump and hydrated. Try not to talk or move your face too much with this mask on! title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
content:
I've been using this as a morning cleanser. I have oily skin but in my mid-thirties I haven't had issues with acne for over a decade so this isn't exactly targeted for me.

The packaging is quite nice, the little pump doesn't dispense too much and you don't need much for it to be effective. Note: the packaging recommends 2-3 drops, which I think could be mistaken for pumps, but you don't need more than one pump.

The clear formula doesn't really foam that much, for something advertised that way. It does have a strong tea tree smell, which people will either like or hate. I think it's alright, not my personal favorite.

It leaves my skin feeling clean, soft and not stripped which is good for this kind of thing. Dehydration is a huge issue for people treating acne, back when I was a teen all the products seemed designed to dry the crap out of your skin with the idea of "drying" the acne out. I'm glad to see more of a focus on gentle cleansing, PH balancing and barrier repair now.

While this isn't targeting my specific issues, and it hasn't changed the oiliness of my face throughout the day, I think it's a nice formula and would be great for someone struggling with acne. It is a little pricey for the size of the product when there are many good K-beauty cleansers out there.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
content:
This is made by a respected K-beauty brand, and I thought it might be nice for me since I have combo skin with the occasional blemish outside of the combo zone. However, I found this to be a bit more than I need. When you get tea tree products, you never know how tea tree forward they will be, and this smells really tea tree forward to me (the scent also lingers).

The scent is much too strong for me to enjoy, but those who enjoy products that are tea tree forward will like this, and it has a lot of soothing botanicals and ceramide to help heal skin.

Note that this has isopropyl alcohol in it, but it's low on the ingredient list. Alcohol not only functions as a solvent (helpful for botanical extracts), but it also has preservative functions, and indeed this product seems gently preserved.

Ingredients (as pictured on box; order slightly different on Dr.Jart+ website): Water Aqua\Eau, Disodium Laureth Sulfosuccinate, Methylpropanediol, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Salicylic Acid, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Leaf Oil, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Leaf Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Glycerin, Camellia Sinensis (Green Tea) Leaf Extract, Allantoin, Niacinamide, Ficus Carica (Fig) Fruit Extract, Centella Asiatica Extract, Hamamelis Virginiana (Witch Hazel) Extract, Camphor, Ulmus Davidiana Root Extract, Anthemis Nobilis (Chamomile) Flower Extract, Undaria Pinnatifida Extract, Amaranthus Caudatus Seed Extract, Sarcosine, Gloiopeltis Furcata Extract, Cinnamomum Zeylanicum Bark Extract, Ceramide NP, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Pinus Pinaster Bark Extract, Isopropyl Alcohol, Polyglyceryl-10 Laurate, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Capryloyl Glycine, Hexylene Glycol, Silica, Pentylene Glycol, 4-Terpineol, Disodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Caprylyl Glycol

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content:
I am reviewing the Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin, 4.06 fl oz. This face wash comes in a pump bottle. Personally, I don't need my cleanser to foam a lot, but I know a lot of people like foam.

This face wash has an extremely strong tea tree scent. It makes sense, given that is the featured ingredient, but it is still a lot. I did find this face wash somewhat drying (it left my skin squeaky), but it is meant for oily skin. I'll stick to using this face wash during hormonal breakouts. It is too strong for the rest of the month. The cleanser does have moisturizing ingredients like allantoin and ceramides to balance the tea tree oil, but it is still a powerful ingredient.

This cleanser is definitely meant to control breakouts. I think it is good for that use.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

Also, the directions say to use 2 to 3 pumps, but one pump is definitely sufficient. It is a great product and I will replace it when I finish it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content:
Getting pimple breakouts in my middle years is super fun. üôÑ Dr Jart is a very well regarded Korean brand that's widely available internationally, so I was curious to try this product.

The first time I used it, I used one entire pump of product. Let me tell you - that is way, way too much. You truly only need a little bit! The next time, I used just a small partial pump and it was better. Neither time did the cleanser "foam". The scent is pretty strong of tea tree oil, very much like eucalyptus. I personally find the smell invigorating, but if you're scent sensitive, I'd give this a pass.

As far as the cleansing goes, I didn't find it drying at all. My face felt clean and perhaps lightly exfoliated. I had a breakout or two starting and they didn't get worse after using this - if anything they got better (but I can't say it was the direct result of using this product because I have other things I'm doing in tandem re the breakouts).

I think this is a nice product. I wish the pump on the bottle wasn't so strong because I used maybe a week or two of product the first time! I'm also not sure about the "foam". I'll continue to use this to prevent full breakouts!

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: I had heard of this brand many times and decided to try the Dr. Jart Cleansing Foam Face Wash. I can totally understand the hype now because this cleaner is absolutely fabulous! I love the gel consistency that makes a rich, quick-cleansing foam, and the tea tree scent is very minimal and smells fresh. This cleanser is perfect for summer weather as it removes dirt and oil quickly without requiring a lot of rinsing, and it is even good for normal skin types. I love it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: This is a nice foaming cleanser that is refreshing and pleasant to use. I am glad that it doesn't appear to contain any added artificial fragrance, but it does have a couple of ingredients that could cause irritation in people with sensitive skin. I don't do great with products that contain chamomile--it's subtle, but I've noticed that whenever I use products with this ingredient, I might sneeze soon after using it, get watering eyes or maybe even a headache in the case of a leave on product. This is just me because I seem to have a mild allergy so this will probably work well for most, but just be aware that this isn't guaranteed to be perfectly gentle on sensitive skin--like with any product, do a little patch test first to make sure it agrees with your skin. I would say this cleanser is worth trying if your skin is congested.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Cleansing Foam Face Wash for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content:
When I saw that this cleansing foam by Dr. Jart features tea tree oil I thought to give it a try. Tea tree oil is something I am very familiar with since I used to wash my face with tea tree soap when I was a teenager, of course back then we just called it "green soap".

Since I love the clean and clinical smell of tea tree but not the drying effects, I'd hoped there would be enough other ingredients in this cleanser to balance it out.

It really only takes a couple drops of the cleanser and a bit of water to get my face thoroughly clean. This cleanser does smell strongly of tea tree, just an FYI. It rinses off very easily and left my skin feeling squeaky clean but not particularly moisturized at all.

Other than the tea tree oil this cleansing foam also contains salicylic acid, witch hazel and camphor. My dry, sensitive skin is cringing. But wait! This cleanser also contains Allantoin, niacinamide, centella, ceramide NP and plenty of plant arrived extracts and oils. That is a lot of very nice hydrating, repairing and protecting ingredients.

Unfortunately, with the salicylic acid, witch hazel and camphor, this cleanser is not for my skin, but gosh I wish I had it when my skin was oilier and prone to breakouts. Overall I think it's a great formulation but likely meant for younger faces.

At the time of this review, Teatreement Cleansing Foam is selling for $29. It looks to be a well-balanced formulation for oily complexions and I think it is a good value, especially considering it's a good size bottle at 4 oz.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content:
The Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser is a gentle yet effective solution for those with sensitive or redness-prone skin. This cleanser is part of the popular Cicapair line, which is known for its soothing properties, particularly due to the inclusion of Centella Asiatica, or Cica, a key ingredient celebrated for its calming and healing benefits.

The cleanser comes out as a light, airy foam that feels soft and soothing on the skin. It effectively removes impurities, excess oil, and makeup without stripping the skin of its natural moisture. This is particularly important for sensitive skin types, which can easily become irritated or dry with harsh cleansers.

One of the standout features of this face wash is its calming effect. The Centella Asiatica extract works wonders in reducing redness and soothing inflammation, making it a great choice for those dealing with irritation or rosacea. The formula is also free from harsh chemicals and artificial fragrances, which further minimizes the risk of irritation.

In terms of usage, the foaming action provides a refreshing and thorough cleanse, leaving the skin feeling clean and balanced. It's suitable for daily use and works well as part of a gentle skincare routine. The packaging is practical, with a pump dispenser that makes it easy to use and control the amount of product.

Overall, the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser is a fantastic choice for anyone seeking a gentle, calming cleanser that effectively cleanses without causing irritation. Its soothing properties and gentle formula make it ideal for sensitive skin, and it provides a refreshing, comfortable cleansing experience. While it might be a bit more expensive than some other cleansers on the market, the benefits it offers for sensitive and redness-prone skin make it well worth the investment.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
content: Super happy with how this one feels! Love that it doesnt have too strong of a smell and the way it feels. It leaves your face feeling nice and clean without feeling to slimy.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
content: I've been a fan of Dr.Jart for a long time now so I was excited for the opportunity to review this. This is a thick, greenish colored cleanser that almost has a gel like consistency to it. It works into the skin really well and penetrates through dirt and oil pretty well. I didn't get a huge foam out of this, which I would say was a really good thing. This gives a lot of hydration while still giving the cleansing benefits of a foaming cleanser. It is a little pricey, so if you're on a budget I would say you could definitely find something a little better at your local brick and mortar. However, on the whole this was a really lovely experience for a cleanser.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content: This foaming face wash arrived nicely boxed at 3.38 fl oz. in a squeeze tube. It comes out a pale green cream that once it touches your wet face really foams up! It did a really good job cleaning my dirty oily skin and taking my makeup off. My skin felt clean and didn't feel tight or dry afterwards. I enjoyed using it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
content: I‚Äôm familiar with the brand but I‚Äôve never used anything from them. This cleanser is not drying and doesn‚Äôt have a fragrance. It is a little expensive for what it is. I prefer cheaper cleansers and to spend more on toners or serums that are calming.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz

I will probably keep buying this to keep on hand!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz

It feels like it severely dries out my skin and doesn‚Äôt help with my skin‚Äôs complexion. Just because it doesn‚Äôt work on my skin, doesn‚Äôt mean it won‚Äôt on yours. Like I said, not a bad cleanser just not my favorite

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
content:
Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Cleanser smells like plastic, but it‚Äôs tolerable enough for me to use. The cream is pale green and has a creamy lather. It is moisturizing. It rinsed easily and cleanly. No squeaking or residue left on my skin. Don‚Äôt think I noticed any brightening, which is fine. Just an observation. I don‚Äôt know if this is gentle for the eyes since I did not attempt to try with this cleanser. Mine expires on 2026/05/23. Discard after 12 months of opening. Made in Korea. Overall, I think it‚Äôs good, but nothing miraculous or impressive yet either. I haven‚Äôt experienced any negative side effects. The scent is probably the only thing I could think of that might deter someone. I‚Äôll update my review in the future if necessary.

-Ingredients-
WATER\AQUA\EAU, GLYCERIN, SODIUM COCOYL ISETHIONATE, GLYCERYL STEARATE, STEARYL ALCOHOL, LAURAMIDOPROPYL BETAINE, COCO-BETAINE, SODIUM METHYL COCOYL TAURATE, HYDROXYPROPYL STARCH PHOSPHATE, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL, QUILLAJA SAPONARIA BARK EXTRACT, THEOBROMA CACAO (COCOA) EXTRACT, STREPTOCOCCUS THERMOPHILUS FERMENT, GLYCINE SOJA (SOYBEAN) PEPTIDE, BUTYLENE GLYCOL, HEDERA HELIX (IVY) EXTRACT, ASIATICOSIDE, MADECASSIC ACID, ASIATIC ACID, MORINGA OLEIFERA SEED EXTRACT, ETHYLHEXYLGLYCERIN, CENTELLA ASIATICA LEAF EXTRACT, SODIUM CHLORIDE, COCO-GLUCOSIDE, CITRIC ACID, DEXTRIN, 1,2-HEXANEDIOL, MALTODEXTRIN, DISODIUM EDTA, GLUCONOLACTONE, MADECASSOSIDE, BLUE 1 (CI 42090), YELLOW 5 (CI 19140)

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
content: I have tried and use other Dr.Jart products and am very happy with them but this was a miss for me. This was no better than any other cleanser, in fact, I prefer less expensive ones that I've tried. For the price, I expected to be wowed and this was just mediocre at best. I am not a fan of the tube-style application for storage or for applying. I hate having to measure out and guess how much to use, versus a pump-style that measures for me. My skin felt dry after washing with this. Not stripped of all oils, but drier than I would like, especially for its claim to be hydrating. The scent is off-putting, like old fashioned soap.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content: The Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash comes well packaged and includes instructions and ingredients listed on the side. The tube comes sealed but once dispensed the wash is a pale green color. There is no scent to the wash and the pea size amount goes a long way. I moisten my face with warm water, massage in the wash and then use a natural Konjac sponge to exfoliate. After exfoliating, I clear the cleanser with warm water, followed by cold to close my pores. After cleansing, and using toner, I didn't notice a large amount of dirt, which made me happy and my skin felt soft but cleansed. I am not someone who wears makeup so the wash is only clearing off serum and lotion so I can't speak to that level of cleansing. Overall, I would recommend this product as you only need a little to go a long way!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content: Hands down one of my favorite facial washes I've tried. I am more into foaming washes as compared to milky or oily based washes so this one met and exceeded by expectations. It cleans off even full coverage makeup.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: I have used other products from the dr jart cicapair line and been quite happy with them. In fact I would highly recommend them. This face wash is nothing special at all. In fact I have to say I prefer my ceraVe face wash over this. This is supposed to be hydrating and I‚Äôm not getting that from this. I will say my skin doesn‚Äôt feel stripped of its natural oils and barrier after washing so that is a plus. Personally I would say there are far better face washes out there and this is one that can be avoided. I also don‚Äôt like the smell of it. It smells very soap like and is really unappealing to me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: I double cleanse my face using an oil cleanser first and then foaming cleanser like this one. This cleanser has a creamy green color out of the tube and a tiny pea sized amount is all that is needed for tons of soft suds. It rinses cleanly and leaves my skin feeling soft and not at all dried out. This foaming face wash is a great addition to my skincare routine and I would definitely recommend it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: The Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser is fantastic. I haven't found a Dr.Jart product that I don't like yet! This face wash is gentle but effective and gets all of the dirt and oil off your face at the end of the day. It's very foamy and leaves your face feeling soft and clean after use.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: I have very sensitive skin so I‚Äôm nervous and careful about what cleaner I use. This is a great product and works very well. It did not irritate my skin and left it feeling clean and soft.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: This is an amazing cleanser, probably in the top 3 I've tried, and I've tried over a hundred face washes already. This face wash DOESN'T dry my face whatsoever! In fact, my skin feels as if I put a facial lotion on after washing. You'd think that a cleanser like this wouldn't be able to clean your skin? You'd be wrong. This gently foaming face wash completely removed thick layers of waterproof sunscreen and makeup I've been wearing. Usually foaming cleansers clean so good that the skin is left dry like paper, but this product moisturizes while cleansing, just amazing.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
content: I started using this after I fell in love the with moisturizer. Very gentle and effective!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: Love Dr. Jart products so I was excited to try this cleanser! It foams well and the product is fairly generously sized. No real scent to speak of. Rinses cleanly without being too harsh. Recommended!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content:
Another winner from Dr. Jart! They can do no wrong. I got hooked with their Cicapair green cream which helps to tone down redness. The foaming face wash does an amazing job at making my face squeaky clean while not being harsh. It lathers up with a little bit of water and covers the skin quickly with circular motions. It‚Äôs unscented so it won‚Äôt irritate the skin with fragrance. The main ingredient is Cica, a plant derivative that is all the rage in the Kbeauty world. Dr. Jart was one of the first brands to bring it to the market. It helps calm sensitive skin and reduces inflammation.

This is a good size tube and a little product goes a long way, so it will last me a while. If you are like me and have sensitive skin that is prone to redness, you will love this cleanser!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content: I honestly didn‚Äôt use very much of this cleanser the first time (think like one garbanzo bean of a squirt) but it was so super foamy! Now i use a little bit less but i love how foamy this gets. It leaves my skin feeling clean and refreshed. And there is a lot in the tube as well! I would say a great value for a good product from a well trusted Korean skincare brand! My only complaint was that it smelled like old beach balls. Very musty and chemically. I trust the product but the smell was off-putting.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2024
content:
As someone with sensitive skin, I'm always on the lookout for cleansers that are tough on dirt but gentle on my face. I've seen this brand at Sephora but haven't given it a try until now.

This cleanser comes in a sleek, pump-dispenser bottle that feels luxurious in the shower. A single pump dispenses a generous amount of creamy lather that feels soft and soothing on the skin. There's a faint herbal scent that I found pleasant and not overpowering.

Does it cleanse? Absolutely. This cleanser does a great job of removing everyday dirt and oil without leaving my skin feeling stripped or dry. My skin feels clean and refreshed after washing, but not tight or uncomfortable. For me, it's perfect for my morning cleanse or as a second cleanse after removing makeup with an oil cleanser. I note second cleanse because this product won't actually clean your face thoroughly if you've got on a full face of makeup or layered up with serums, etc.

The cica ingredient, which is supposed to soothe and calm irritation, is a nice touch for sensitive skin. I haven't experienced any breakouts or redness while using this cleanser, and my skin overall feels calmer and more balanced.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
content: Didn't foam. Hardly any grit. Expensive. It worked fine but I wouldn't buy it again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
content: This is a nice face wash. I like the fact that it foams a lot with a very little amount. I don't find that this product is particularly drying, but I don't find it particularly moisturizing either like some other face washes I've used. I do put toner, serum, and moisturizer on afterward, so for me that isn't an issue. I do think there is a scent but I can't really distinguish what scent it is. It is quite mild tho.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
content:
Review: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Foaming Face Wash Cleanser | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 fl oz

I generally like Dr. Jart products and in all honesty love most K-beauty products so this review may be biased. The cleanser is foaming. I must agree I didn't use as much as the model in the product listing used in that video - at that rate, I could wash 3 faces! I also used it right after an oil cleansing so mine didn't necessarily foam but more emulsified and cleaned my skin off the melted makeup and oil. I've never found a cleanser that made me ksip moisturizing so I did follow up with a serum and moisturizer afterwards. Overall good product but about 2x as pricey as some other K beauty brands.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

I don‚Äôt think it exfoliated much. It smell slightly minty like mouthwash, which was very unexpected. I‚Äôll keep using it for now because it doesn‚Äôt irritate my sensitive skin, but I‚Äôll have to see if there are any changes in order to buy it again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

content:
I got this Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum as I was curious the pore treatment that will drive a cleaner and smoother skin.
The product description says that is a water-like serum and it is correct, just like water which I did not like as there is too much of the serum staying in my hand to just apply a little bit on my face. I end up applying the left over on my hand which is not what I wanted.

For the price tag and the amount of waste I do not like the value proposition.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

content:
I like the watery consistency, it allows me to spread just the slightest amount evenly over my entire face. It‚Äôs feels lightweight on the skin but has some initial moisturizing properties, your skin won‚Äôt feel bone dry after application. However I absolutely have to use a good rich cream on top because over night it tightens and exfoliates.
The scent is a minty medicinal scent but nothing overpowering and it doesn‚Äôt linger. Slightly cooling but doesn‚Äôt burn. My skin does look fresher and brighter. Very happy with the quality.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content:
I recently tried the Dr. Jart+ Pore Remedy Exfoliating Face Serum on my sensitive skin and it worked well. I didn't experience any irritation or redness after applying it.

The serum is quite watery compared to other serums I've used in the past, so it's important to be patient when dispensing it. Although it's a bit pricier, I found that it effectively hydrates my skin. However, as I've only just started using this product, I can't provide a more detailed review. I did find that it layers well with my existing moisturizer.

Overall, I like this serum, but I think it could be improved by making it thicker in consistency.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
content: I just do not like this serum. Its not a serum. Serums are thick and feel like youre actually putting something serum like on your skin. This is jus so watery. You cant use your fingers to put it on, you have to squirt it onto a cotton ball or disc because it just runs right off your fingers. I feel like im just wasting it to put it on a cotton ball. its more like a micellar water than a serum. I also dont think it does anything to exfoliate. I used it on my t-zone several times and started getting a weird pimple on my nose in the most off the wall place, and I dont get acne, so this had to be from this product. Ive used it a couple other times just as a light face wash/micellar type thing and it feels a bit refreshing but using it as a serum is just not possible. Not really a fan and definitely will not ever get it again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
content:
This serum is good quality and seems to have good ingredients. It does seem to do what it says, leaving my skin feeling cleaner, smoother, softer. I also like the look of the container and packaging, feels luxury.

That said, it's a pain to apply. It's like the thinnest water you've ever tried to put on your face. It's very hard to pump a little on your fingers and get it on your face before it's running between your fingers. I ended up having to do quite a few pumps to get enough on my face. I feel like at this price, I don't really want to be wasting any running down my hands. I wish they could make it a little thicker so it would be easier to apply.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content:
After weeks of testing this serum I think I have finally formed an opinion.

- I know this sounds weird but just by looking at its packaging, it feels like they really know when they are doing and its the best packaging they could possibly do. It feels very responsible and intention so 5/5 for that.
- Even though its all liquid, its not hard to handle, it rubs quickly into the skin and dries fast.
- After weeks of testing this out, I don't see a huge difference in my pores, they are still the same but I have noticed a slight "evening" of the skin, I have some parts on my face that are darker than the others but I feel like is a degree more even.
- No effect on blackheads.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

The consistency is as thin as water, which can make it tricky to apply. It is not oily, but it leaves a tacky residue. It makes my skin feel smoother and look more refreshed. I am happy with the effectiveness and will continue to use it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content: I like this serum a lot. It helps exfoliate my skin and reduces the look of my pores.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
content: I wasn‚Äôt sure I was going to like this serum at first. When I received it, some of the serum had leaked out in the box (just a little bit) even though it was sealed. This serum is very thin. Make sure you‚Äôre careful when you pump the serum. The first time I used it, the serum squirted out on my fingers and then onto my bathroom sink. Since the serum was so thin I just put some on my fingertips and then patted it on my face. I wasn‚Äôt crazy about the scent, it's not a strong scent and I really can‚Äôt put my finger on what it smells like (luckily the scent dissipated quickly). So like I said, after all of this I didn‚Äôt think I was going to like this serum but boy I changed my mind once a felt my skin after using this. My skin felt so smooth and soft. I couldn‚Äôt believe how soft it made my skin. I did have a little bit of flaking around my chin area after using a couple times but this is an exfoliating serum so obviously it‚Äôs doing it‚Äôs job at getting rid of my dead skin cells. Anxious to see if there will be a noticeable difference in my skin tone and texture after consistent use. Even though this serum is a little pricey I could see myself getting it again depending on the results I see.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
content: This arrived leaking with at least a quarter of the bottle in the package itself. It was oily and hard to get off everything

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

content: I like that it's easy to use and can be applied in the morning and at night. It's lightweight but almost too watery for my preference. It absorbs quickly and a little product goes a long way. It didn't cause any redness or irritation to my skin. Hoping this serum helps improve my skin's texture.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
content: I like this, but it is watery!

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: This review is for the Dr. Jart+ Pore Remedy PHA exfoliating face serum. It comes in a square green glass bottle with a pump. You do have to shake the liquid to mix it up before dispensing. The instructions say to use 2-3 pumps on your face, which is about enough. I've owned Dr. Jart products before and like them, but my one criticism of this is that being such a thin liquid, it's hard to apply because it tends to leak between your fingers before you can get your cupped hand onto your face. It's probably most advisable to use a cotton round. I can't tell yet whether this is helping to exfoliate my face.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

The texture is lightweight and easy to apply. It makes my skin smooth and less congested. I don't like that there's alcohol and essential oils though, which can be drying.
