title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
content:
I have to be pretty careful with most skin care products as I have sensitive skin and many things just don't work for my skin. This product actually has been very easy on my skin and hasn't given me any discomfort or irritation, which is a big plus. This serum is light and has the consistency of water. It's very thin and light and easy to apply to the skin.

Getting older I can see more of my pores - they are visible and some seem like craters. I also tend to get blackheads around my nose that are pesky and hard for me to get rid of. I usually take what products say they will do with a grain of salt because in my experience, they don't work as stated they should. But from my use of this product I can visibly notice a difference in most of my larger pores. These pores have decreased in size to where some aren't even noticeable anymore. This has greatly improved the way my skin looks, at least to me anyway. And my blackheads? Well, they haven't totally disappeared but there's defiantly not as many around my nose area.

So far I've been liking the results from using this product but it is expensive for only slightly over one ounce of product. I do see this product lasting me for quite some time seeing how I only use a little at a time but at the current price I couldn't see myself purchasing this on a monthly or even bi-monthly basis. Time will tell how long this actually lasts me but if it would last a few months at a time then it might be something I would realistically use and purchase on a regular basis.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
content: This serum is watery, not oily like others. I'm not sure I like it very much as I could feel it on my face all day! I also started having breakouts, but that may have possibly due to a sunscreen I was wearing with this product.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
content: So this feels more like a toner than a serum or exfoliator to me. I tried to squirt it directly to my face and it didn‚Äôt really work. Then I put it on a cotton round and it basically just felt cleaning and astringent like a toner. I didn‚Äôt notice any reduction in dead skin/dry patches on my face in the week or so I‚Äôve used it but it also didn‚Äôt irritate my sensitive skin. The smell is tolerable. I‚Äôll give a few more weeks. But for the price I think there are better exfoliants, toners and serums.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy PHA Exfoliating Face Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

content:
This is a great, gentle, little bottle of PHA exfoliator. I have noticed a slight difference in only a week. I feel like it has made my skin brighter because of the exfoliating. I have noticed a difference in that and my skin just looks and feels cleaner.
The only thing that I disliked is the texture of the serum. It is too watery and I think I lose a good amount of product as I attempt to use it, which is not good because there is not much product to begin with. It could be improved by having a spray or dropper.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content:
I love a good clay mask- I always feel super refreshed after using them, and this one was no different! Really smart application, really cooling and lovely when applied. I really loved this mask, and definitely recommend it! It helped improve the tone of my skin, reducing redness without causing dried out spots, which sometimes happens to me with clay masks.

I have sensitive skin, including psoriasis on my face, and many products cause irritation and discomfort for me. I was a bit nervous with how close this product was to my under-eyes due to the shape of the eye holes, since I am prone to periorbital dermatitis, but this mask did not cause any flare ups, irritation or discomfort anywhere on my face.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024
content:
This review is for the Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Purifying Mud Face Mask, 0.46 Ounce.
I have dry-ish mature skin with oily pores. I‚Äôve used clay masks quite a few times- I have a tub of clay powder that I mix, usually with apple cider vinegar. I don‚Äôt do this nearly as often as my skin would like because it‚Äôs a mess- the bowl, the sink, the face cloth all need to be cleaned of green mud. I also don‚Äôt like the hardened mask because it aggravates my TMJD pain. Basically I love the effects of clay masks but hate doing them.
This clay sheet mask is brilliant. It is easy to apply and left no mess to clean up. I also loved that it didn‚Äôt leave a layer of dried mud on my face that I had to soften and scrub off- it left only a tiny bit of a residue that easily wiped clean.
More about the sheet mask: I didn‚Äôt detect any fragrance. The coverage of the mask was very good but I wish that it wrapped just under the edge of my chin a little bit. It also didn‚Äôt have 100% coverage on the sides of my nose but I was able to manipulate the mask to cover most of the gap after peeling off the top layer. It was super comfortable to wear and stayed fairly flexible, never cracking. The mask stayed on well. It peeled off very easily and the light residue wiped off with a clean cloth. My skin was left feeling a little tighter (in a good way) but not overly dry.
Overall the ease of this mask is 5 out of 5. However I don‚Äôt think that it was quite as effective as a traditional clay mask- it didn‚Äôt seem to draw out as much probably because it didn‚Äôt cover the face as thickly and didn‚Äôt dry completely. Though more than I would normally spend on a single face mask, I think that the price is fairly reasonable for the quality and ease of this mask- premium ingredient face masks are not cheap.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content: Really impressed with this face mask. Left my skin feeling super soft and hydrated.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
content: It's a bit drying on my skin. It was a fun experience, but the price... Can't really tell if there are long-lasting, or if any effects - since there is only one mask and limited results after a single use - but it was fun and felt good.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content: I think I prefer a regular spreadable clay mask to this sheet mask. The whole point of using clay is to get in contact with the skin so that it can work on drawing out the impurities. By putting clay in the cloth mask it stuck to the fabric more than my skin. The instructions were also a bit confusing. The mask comes in two pieces but is backed on both sides. It said to remove the white back and apply then remove the clear top piece. What it didn't say is that you should do each half one at a time. I took off the white backs and positioned the sheets but then they overlapped making it difficult to get the clear top off the bottom piece. It caused the mask to stretch out some so the already very thin piece between the nose and lips was pretty much gone. It claims to be designed to stick better to problem areas like your nose but that is where it worked the worst. My cheek and forehead skin felt smoother after using but the rest of my face didn't feel like it even came in contact with it. This mask was such a mess and so much hassle. There are so many options out there. I don't plan on revisiting this one. I don't think clay and sheet masks play well together.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
content: What a lovely mask! It's a clay mask, but it's applied like a sheet mask! I thought it felt nice on - cooling, not drying. My skin felt tight and clean when I was done. It was a simple removal that didn't require scrubbing to get it all off. I would use this again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content: Dr. Jart+ is a brand name that I‚Äôm familiar with and have used before. This face mask is one time use. Easy to use. Face feels refreshed after using this. Would get this again!

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content: My skin felt very refreshed and smooth after using this. It was easy to put on and didn't have any harsh odors. There is some extra plastic to peel off, but other than that it seems like a standard face mask.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: I am a sucker for K-beauty and Dr.Jart+ is a good brand, but I just don't think this pore remedy mud mask (which I tried through Amazon Vine) is worth the high cost - $10 - for a mask that is way too easy to get wrong as you are trying to apply it / peel off the plastic sheeting. I think a jarred mud mask that you can apply precisely as a cream at the thickness you prefer, allow to dry, and wash away offers better value. What this mask offers is the novelty factor of peeling away the material with the hope of seeing pore filaments or blackheads pull out. I did NOT experience that, BTW - this did not work like a pore strip for me. It does de-oilify somewhat, but don't get excited about this as a pore clearer. It does a little light tightening but any mud mask will do that. I also don't think it really suits a sensitive skin, despite what the product photos suggest. This left my skin rather red. Overall, ehh.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Purifying Mud Face Mask, 0.46 Ounce

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: Yes, you do only get one mask. The listing doesn't say otherwise and purchasing this brand at any other retail beauty store also only provides one mask at this price point. Some reviewers... I tell you... Anyway, I can't swear up and down this works because most skincare takes more than one use. However, I can say this felt nice on and my skin felt refreshed after using it. My pores at least for a few hours did seem visibly tighter. I also think it's a pretty unique mask because while I've used plenty of sheet masks in my day, I never saw a clay based one. To be honest, I think I prefer non-sheet masks, but that is a personal preference. I appreciate that this is fragrance-free too. I agree this isn't a very good value for a one-time use product, however, some people aren't concerned with budgets and at least upon first impressions it seems to do what it claims. This is a higher end brand and doesn't claim to be a budget friendly one, so if that isn't a concern to you, go for it. You might like the unique delivery.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content:
Pros:
It's kind of nice that it's 2 pieces instead of one (there's a top and a bottom), because it's easier to adjust. I think I have a shorter face, so sheet masks normally are too long for my face and fit weird.
It felt nice and tingly while I was wearing it, and it stayed on better than sheet masks usually do, which was nice. My skin afterwards felt soft.

Cons:
It has plastic on both sides, which made it kind of a pain to peel, stick on, and then try to peel off the other side while it's on your face. It was slightly less messy than a regular clay mask, but I still had to rinse my face afterwards. It felt like a gimmick, a clay mask trying to be a sheet mask, and I just don't think it was worth the effort.

I don't regret it, but I wouldn't pay more than $3 for it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
content:
This mask is unusual in that it is applied as a true mask - do not apply it to the face as a cream. The actual clay is sandwiched between two protective plastic layers: first remove the protective layer that protects the clay side that is applied to the face and once pressed onto the face then remove the remaining upper plastic layer and you will have a green ‚Äúmask‚Äù over your face.

I left my mask on for the 15 minutes as directions stated and then rinsed it off. I loved how my complexion looked and felt after this process. The pores on my face looked cleaner therefore less noticeable and the ruddy redness of my complexion was more toned down and a lot of the redness disappeared for the day so I did not need to apply foundation. I would love to do this mask once a week it‚Äôs a bit of a high price point but still deserves 5 stars from me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
content: The packet contains one single-use mask, which is quite easy to apply (just follow the instructions). The mask stays on easily, just large enough to cover the face. However, I do not feel like it was as effective as a regular clay mask would be - while it does provide contact between the skin and the mud, it does not seem to absorb quite as much, and the results are not nearly as pronounced. So while there are positive points for convenience, the outcome and the cost of this single treatment should be considered when selecting this product vs. traditional mud/clay mask.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content: This mask left my skin feeling moisturized. It is easy to apply, and then you just peel it off. I washed away the excess, and didn't apply moisturizer. I thought my skin felt like I already had applied it. This is a great brand, and I have always been impressed by their products.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy‚Ñ¢ Purifying Mud Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz

content: Dr. Jart+ products are amazing and this Vital hydra solution hydro plumb overnight mask has to be the favorite product. I have tried from this brand. I have been using this every single night since I got it and I still have a good amount in this jar maybe a little bit more than half so and I have gotten so many compliments on my skin since I started using this, my skin is glowing. title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz

content: Mask has a nice gel cream texture which is refreshing and helps the mask to feel light. There is a slight "unscented" scent but it is very mild. I applied a thin layer and there is a slight tackiness left on my skin but it is not uncomfortable. When I woke up my skin did not feel too greasy. My skin felt moisturized and plump.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content: The Dr.Jart Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask isn't really a traditional face mask product. In fact, I don't know why it is called a mask as it doesn't harden up and doesn't need to peel off. This product is more as a hydro face cream that gets washed off in the morning. The product does contain Hyaluronic acid so you will feel a tingling when you rub it into your skin, and definitely needs to be washed off in the morning. I tried my first application after a shower, but only left it on for 2 hours and washed it off before I went to bed. The product does work well and my skin did look and feel different, but I wanted to test it out first and not risk a full 8 hours until I seen there wasn't any skin reaction. My next application will be for 4 hours, then 8, but as far as I can tell, this is a good product that has skin care value.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: I have combination skin and the dry areas of my face get really dry during the summer months. I need to go beyond a good moisturizer, so I decided to try this face mask. First of all, I did not get a smell off of it. I like that, having something overnight on my face with a strong smell would be overwhelming for me. I must admit, I put it on a quarter of my face, the bottom left side. I did that because I wanted to make sure I didn't have a bad reaction, and because I can compare the findings with the rest of my face. The mask has the composition of a cool, medium thick moisturizer. I applied it and it felt normal on my skin. It dried pretty quickly. I was afraid it would cover my things in it, but it didn't. Where I applied, my skin is softer and a little more hydrated. This was my first attempt so I expect it will get better with each application.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz

content: This overnight face mask feels like my skin soaks it up immediately, my skin is noticeably moisturized by the time I wake up in the morning. Does leave a residue on your face you have to rinse off in the morning.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
content:
I use this as my night cream, as opposed to "mask" a few nights per week, as the last step in my skincare routine, and when I wake up, my skin is hydrated, plump and glowing!

This mask is very hydrating, yet not greasy, and does not irritate my sensitive skin (I cannot detect any fragrance), although due to the hyaluronic acid, my skin does tingle a bit when initially applying.

During the colder months, when my skin is much more dry, I'd like to use this nightly. For extra hydration during those months, I will often layer two different night creams as my last skincare step at night, so I think this would be an excellent last step even over night cream when your skin is extra dry, or if your skin is just moderately dry, this mask would be excellent used as a night cream.

Highly recommended!

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz

content: I have been using this overnight mask for three weeks now, and I am content with the results. With a few rubs on the face, the mask easily absorbs into the skin, and washing off in the morning is an a quick task. As an alternative to wearing face masks, this overnight mask is a great option. title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content:
I ordered this cream because I decided that my skin needed some additional TLC. I received it within a day and used it the same night. My skin has felt a little rough and tired and nothing seems to have helped earlier.
The next morning my skin was softer and hydrated. The hyaluronic acid of course helped, but the effect does not usually stay overnight. I am pleased with this, especially since it is used over my other skin care products. It gives the skin a real pampering. DrJart+ is of course a well-respected brand and this cream lives up to its name. The carton and container provide all information about the product. The cream itself is almost translucent and a little goes a long way. My skin immediately feels soft and hydrated when I apply it. I love this cream and will continue to use it. title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: When I say "very extra," I mean that this mask is meant to go on the skin after cleansing, using a toner/essence, nighttime serum, eye cream and moisturizer...so it really is a lot of "extra" hydration going on top of your moisturizer and what have you. The ingredient list passed all of my super picky requirements--gluten/colorant/fragrance free amongst other things for my super sensitive, highly reactive dry skin. I do feel like I smell the slightest/faintest scent, but it doesn't list fragrance as an added ingredient so I think I will remain confident that this is truly free of added artificial fragrance which is always problematic for me. I love the colorless, lightweight, gel-like texture of this mask and it absolutely plumps and hydrates my skin by morning time--it definitely is an extra treat for skin that does add something to the overall bounce of my skin texture. I like it and could see me reordering this down the road when I run out, but only time will tell for sure if this really makes a long term difference in my skin's plumpness and hydration. I will update this review if my opinion changes over time.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content:
This overnight face mask delivers a heft dose of moisture while you sleep.
It contains hyaluronic acid, panthenol, and Pentavitin, which provide unbeatable hydration.
Hyaluronic acid attracts and retains water and forms a hydrating layer.
Pentavitin binds to the skins‚Äô keratin and provides 72-hour moisture so it doesn‚Äôt just rinse off.
Panthenol (pro-vitamin B5) also attracts water and is good for wound healing and skin repair.
Together, this is a lot of moisture for the skin!!
It comes in a sealed box and expires October 2026 if unopened and 12 months after opening.
It‚Äôs unscented and has a gel-cream consistency. Absorption is fast, less than 15 seconds. It feels a little tacky because of the barrier-protection ingredients so wearing this at night makes sense.
I apply it after cleansing, toning, and using a retinol serum.
In the morning my skin feels sooo soft and bouncy and looks plumper. At 50 years-old this is exactly what I want!
This is one of those products that can provide very quick results in appearances because of the way it draws in moisture. There aren‚Äôt really many longer-term age-fighting ingredients so I will make sure to use this in conjunction with retinol, peptides, niacinamide, and amino acids.
This is a good one to try, especially if you have parched skin!

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Overnight Face Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 2.53 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
content:
I'm frustrated with my recent purchase. I ordered the product based on the manufacturer's claims in the ad, but the website did not list the full ingredients, which made it difficult to make an educated purchase. Other reviews have since shown images of the box with the full ingredients, which the manufacturer should have been transparent about from the start, given the price of the product.

The cosmetics industry has very few regulations, so manufacturers can make unverified claims about their products to attract consumers. It's a 'buyer-beware' industry and essential for buyers to educate themselves in the world of cosmetics and skincare.

Additionally, I'm concerned about the "jar packaging" of the product, as it exposes any beneficial ingredients to air and light, leading to their deterioration and potential contamination. Skincare products containing antioxidants and vitamins should be in airless, opaque, pump bottles or tubes to protect them from air, light, and bacteria.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask for Reducing Oil and Pore Tightening | Bubbling Charcoal Korean Face Mask | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2024
content:
A nice way to start my daily skincare regimen. Of course I always start by washing my face, but this step takes that cleaning aspect a little bit further. Meanwhile, it also hydrates and conditions the skin. Having mature combination skin, I love being able to clean deeper inside of those pores to ensure they are fully cleaned of impurities and excess sebum. Yet, this mask also hydrates and conditions to prepare it for the rest of my skincare regimen.

Once the mask is removed, you can see the extra moisturization. More damp than any sort of emollient layering, but it does add a light and clean layer to get you started. Do let that sit for several minutes to allow it to air dry. Then continue with the rest of your skincare routine. It does leave the skin a slight bit tacky, but don't worry about that because as soon as you add your other skincare products, that tackiness will completely go away. It provides you with a good, healthy start to a good day of a nice looking complexion.

Good for all skin types. Especially for those who need to be careful about ensuring clean and balanced pores. Works well for all adult age groups and is just has helpful for men as it is for women.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask for Reducing Oil and Pore Tightening | Bubbling Charcoal Korean Face Mask | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
content:
I‚Äôm usually a fan of Dr Jart products so I was really excited to try out these Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Masks.

Opening the mask from the packet they are completely drenched in product, so much so that even after you take out the mask there is so much product left inside that you could cover your whole face with it plus more at a later date. But that amount of product on the masks also makes them a bit difficult to open up because they are all like crumpled up in the packet, It took me a good 2 minutes to untangle the mask and get it open, and even then I didn‚Äôt realize there was a nose piece I hadn‚Äôt unfolded at first as you can see in the photos. I was wondering why a pore decongesting mask didn‚Äôt have a nose part! Haha. But I would much rather there be a lot of extra product than not enough, especially considering how expensive they are.

When you have it on it‚Äôs supposed to kind of bubble up, and it does a little towards the end of the 15-20 min, but not as much as I was expecting. It doesn‚Äôt burn or irritate my skin when I have it on, but you can feel that it‚Äôs a little bubbly, almost like what your skin feels like if you spill sparkling water or soda on it.

Once the time is up you take it off and then pat in the rest of the solution on your face and let it absorb. Now I‚Äôm really particular about what I put on my skin because I want it to feel nice. I don‚Äôt like when things are like oily or weird feeling on my face. And sadly this leaves this film on your skin and dries down stiff, so your face feels like you just let glue dry on it even an hour after you take the mask off. It‚Äôs also still tacky as well which I dislike. Now my skin did look nicer after, but I couldn‚Äôt handle the feel for more than an hour and had to rinse it off. So just be mindful that if your like me and don‚Äôt like that kind of consistency on your face that you will likely not like this.

All in all it‚Äôs not bad. I will definitely use these because I can see a slight difference after I use them, but I also don‚Äôt think I would repurchase them after they run out if im being honest.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask for Reducing Oil and Pore Tightening | Bubbling Charcoal Korean Face Mask | Korean Skin Care

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask for Reducing Oil and Pore Tightening | Bubbling Charcoal Korean Face Mask | Korean Skin Care

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask for Reducing Oil and Pore Tightening | Bubbling Charcoal Korean Face Mask | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2024
content:
I always enjoy trying Dr. Jart+ products. This Korean skin care company has been around for 20 years and they are a trusted brand to me. Dermask Porecting Solution Face Mask is formulated for oily skin mainly to purify pores. My skin is mature, but I still have an oilier T zone where pores can get congested. I found this sheet mask a bit overly goopy but that does make it easier to adhere to your face. It‚Äôs a good idea to do this over your sink so you don‚Äôt drip it onto your clothing. It took a while for me to feel the bubbling action. I wouldn‚Äôt say it sudsed a lot, but next time I will try massaging it more to generate more bubbles. I did feel slight tingling that was relaxing for the 15 minutes I kept it on. Quite a bit of product remained on my skin after. After 15 minutes, I gently blotted with a clean face towel. Because I used it at night, I was sure to hit the dryer areas of my face with a moisturizer afterwards. The next morning, my pores looked visibly smaller and purified.

I really like the packaging of this kit. Five individually sealed masks are contained in a 5-pack. That pack is also safety sealed, so if you wished to gift a pack to someone, it is trustworthy looking! I like the idea of using this mask for myself periodically in winter when I wear more makeup that can congest pores. If I were younger, I would use this product weekly to control breakouts. I find this pack of 15 a good value because these are usually $10 per mask when sold individually. Recommend this mask for oily skin or for spot treating oily areas and enlarged pores.

This Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Cream-Infused Face Mask was fun to use and didn‚Äôt take long ‚Ä¶ just 20 minutes. It‚Äôs basically a cream infused material that you lay on your face. It feels cool while you have it on your face. It comes in two pieces ‚Ä¶ one for the upper face including eyes and nose and the second for the lower face, mouth and chin. It‚Äôs easy to apply to the face and you can smooth out the wrinkles to get better coverage.

When I removed it, my face was still covered in cream. The instructions indicate that you should pat it to be absorbed. I haven‚Äôt washed my face but it‚Äôs been several hours and it hasn‚Äôt really completely absorbed. While I liked it on my face initially and basically found it gentle and unscented, I now feel a real urgency to wash my face and my eyes feel irritated by it even though I got nothing in them. I think the best idea is to leave it on for a bit and then rinse off what remains ‚Ä¶ of course, your experience might be different. I would love to try the other ones. I think the mud mask looks interesting.

It came with a single mask and is fun to use though not inexpensive. I don‚Äôt expect it to have a long lasting impact.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Moisturizer for Oily Skin with Niacinamide and Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024
content:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I was excited to try the Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Moisturizer, specifically designed for oily skin types. This Korean skincare brand has created a unique moisturizer that addresses excess oil production and provides a refreshing hydration experience. Here's an honest review of my experience:

Oil Control and Hydration:
One of the standout features of this face moisturizer is its ability to control excess oil production while providing lightweight hydration. The formula, enriched with Niacinamide and Glycerin, helps regulate sebum secretion, leaving the skin feeling refreshed and balanced. My skin tends to get shiny throughout the day, and this moisturizer has helped keep the oiliness at bay, resulting in a more matte and even complexion.

Soothing and Calming:
The formula is infused with tea tree leaf extract, a powerful natural ingredient known for its soothing and calming properties. It helps reduce skin irritation and inflammation, providing relief to stressed complexions. My skin felt comforted and relaxed, especially during periods of sensitivity and reactivity.

Niacinamide's Benefits:
Niacinamide, a form of vitamin B3, offers a range of skin-enhancing benefits. It helps refine the appearance of enlarged pores, improves skin texture, and promotes a more even skin tone. With regular use, I noticed a visible improvement in the overall appearance of my pores and a more radiant complexion.

Lightweight and Quick-Absorbing:
The moisturizer has a lightweight and fluid texture, absorbing quickly into the skin. It provides an instant cooling sensation without leaving any greasy or sticky residue. My skin felt refreshed and revitalized, with no heavy or oily sensation often associated with richer creams.

Suitable for Sensitive Skin:
As a K-beauty enthusiast with sensitive skin, I appreciate that this moisturizer is carefully formulated to be gentle and non-irritating. Free from potential irritants like parabens and fragrances, it ensures a safe and soothing experience for even the most delicate complexions.

Overall Complexion Enhancement:
Not only does this moisturizer address oil control, but it also enhances the overall appearance of the skin. My skin looked healthier and more radiant, with a noticeable improvement in texture and tone. It provided an excellent base for makeup application, creating a smooth and even canvas.

Overall Recommendation:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I highly recommend the Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Moisturizer to anyone seeking a balancing and hydrating solution for oily skin. The formula's tea tree leaf extract, Niacinamide, and lightweight hydration make it a refreshing and effective choice for combating excess oil production.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Moisturizer for Oily Skin with Niacinamide and Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
content:
The lightweight formula of this moisturizer is perfect for oily skin, as it provides hydration without leaving a heavy or greasy feeling on the skin.
I have noticed a significant decrease in the oiliness of my skin since I started using this product regularly.
One of the things I love the most about this moisturizer is its fast-absorbing formula. It sinks into the skin quickly, leaving a smooth and matte finish that is perfect for wearing under makeup.

If I'm spending most of the day inside and put this on once, it makes my skin look soft and healthy. I was hoping to use this on full sun, beach/pool days and this isn't water resistant either. For the price and how often you need to be diligent with spf, I can't see myself spending this much on one sunscreen. I'd recommend it for normal to dry skin, if it's in your budget!

title: Dr.Jart+ Every Sun Day Sun Fluid Sunscreen SPF 50+ for Face | Korean Skin Care, 3.38 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content: I've heard this brand name around for a while. So when I had the opportunity to evaluate this sunscreen, I jumped at it. I wear sunscreen of 50 or more SPF pretty much every day. I have extremely sensitive skin, rosacea, and other issues due to chronic illness. I did not burn as a child but as I've gotten older, I am more susceptible to burning. A reliable sunscreen is a must for me. That said, I'm not too sure how I feel about this one. The second I put it on, my skin burned. Not outrageously, but it was definitely irritating. I did not break out or have any other reaction other than the burning, and that went away fairly quickly. I'm a little concerned that the recommendation for face and hands is a dime-sized amount. When you put on a conventional sunscreen, they recommend a shot glass size, which is much bigger. Sunscreen isn't the kind of thing you should skimp on. That said, it does seem like a little goes a long way, which would be fine for a regular moisturizer, but this is sunscreen. I put it on, let it sink in, and then went outside. Immediately, I felt the sun on my face. When I wear other over-the-counter sunscreen from the drugstore, once I put sunscreen on my skin, I can't feel the sun. But having this on my skin, I felt like I had nothing when I went out. And that, to me, is very alarming. Because of that, I didn't stay out in the direct light for too long. I mostly wore it as I drove my car, and my car has heavily tinted side windows. I wanted to love this product. I just do not feel secure with this on my skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Every Sun Day Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50+ for Face | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Every Sun Day Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50+ for Face | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
content:
My Dr. Jart+ Mineral Sunscreen arrived in a nicely designed box that shows information about the product as well as a list of ingredients and directions for use. The product is made in Canada. Inside is a beautifully designed tube, the cover of which snaps shut. The tiny dispenser hole was sealed with a piece of foil. No date of expiration date is shown either on the box or the tube.

I have tried numerous sunscreens, and this certainly ranks as one of the best from my standpoint for a couple of reasons. Physical (mineral) sunscreens tend to be thick and difficult to apply. More expensive versions are thinner and easier to apply. Chemical sunscreens also fall into the category of being easier to apply but can cost less. Physical sunscreens work by reflecting the sun's rays, and chemical sunscreens work by absorbing the sun's rays. They, then, are absorbed into the skin as opposed to the physical sunscreens, which are not. There is, however, a little confusion here. Physical sunscreens can either use microparticles, which are too large to be absorbed into the skin, or nanoparticles, which are tiny enough to be absorbed. Physical sunscreens with microparticles will stain clothing. This product does not state whether microparticles or nanoparticles are used, but my assumption, due to being able to feel it on top of my skin, indicates to me that microparticles are used. Also, microparticles will very likely make the product visible in terms of leaving a white cast, as opposed to nanoparticle physical sunscreens or chemical sunscreens. Some physical sunscreens use tints to hide the white cast. This Dr. Jart+ Sunscreen, which appears to use microparticles, is not tinted and does not leave a white cast. It is also not watered down as much as those thinner physical sunscreens referred to above. It does, however, go on easily and become invisible. I have not tested its ability to stain, but my assumption is that it will. Its active ingredients and the percentages used indicate a powerful and effective sunscreen, and I highly recommend it. I have paid more for the tiny bottles of thinner physical sunscreens because they are much better in terms of appearance and ease of application, which enhance effectiveness. Also, those tiny bottles last longer than you would think due to the fact that less product is needed in order to provide protection.

I am happy to recommend Dr. Jart+ Mineral Sunscreen because of its invisibility, ease of application, active ingredients (both zinc oxide and titanium dioxide and percentages of those), and, silly me, the beautifully designed packaging. The one criticism I would have is that no expiration date is given. Sunscreens typically last for two years, so that is what I will go by. This is a superior product that, in my opinion, will not disappoint.

title: Dr.Jart+ Every Sun Day Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50+ for Face | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz

I love using this higher level to prevent hyperpigmentation and sun damage in general. What I also appreciate is the creamy matte finish. It works fine over serums and under makeup with no peeling. This is a mineral sunscreen but it doesn‚Äôt leave a white cast on your skin. It is basically invisible. It also does not contain dangerous chemical sunscreens that can be absorbed by the body. The scent is a very faint citrus plus that sunscreen scent. I don‚Äôt smell it after it‚Äôs on.

This is a 1.69 fl oz squeeze tube that will last me a long time as I will be saving this for face, neck and chest. I like that the cap clicks closed to prevent leaks. Dr. Jart is manufactured in Canada. I wish there were an expiration date included but I use sunscreens a couple years if they are still around.

Quality protection and performance. Highly recommend!

title: Dr.Jart+ Every Sun Day Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50+ for Face | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
content:
I avoid products with reviews from people who received them for free. It‚Äôs no surprise most will give positive ratings! It‚Äôs disappointing to see you had to go this route for reviews when you deserve much more honest feedback.

I‚Äôve tried many sunscreens recommended by Angie Hot and Flashy and other beauty influencers, but I still have full bottles of all of them because they just don‚Äôt work for me. These influencers say they get compliments on their skin, but when I use the same products, I get no compliments, and my skin looks worse than without sunscreen. If you use foundation, then I guess it doesn't matter which one you use as the foundation will screw up whatever good effect the sunscreen would have had on its own but this one is good to wear by itself if you mix a little color with it - specifically though, the Australian Gold Deep.

Some sunscreens are too greasy, some are too sparkly, some dry out my skin, some give me milia, and others leave a white cast or burn my eyes. Tinted ones never seem to match my skin tone‚Äîthey're either too pink, too orange, or too dark.

This one is similar to the Dr. G Green sunscreen. Both leave a white cast, but neither dries out my skin or causes those other issues. The white cast from this one is actually a plus because when I mix in a tiny bit of the darkest Australian Gold Rich to Deep Sunscreen, it creates a beautiful natural color on my skin. I‚Äôve even received compliments that I have a nice color to my skin! Plus, I don‚Äôt need to wear any foundation, and I‚Äôm a light Caucasian.

On its own, the Australian Gold makes my skin dry, itchy, and red, but this sunscreen doesn‚Äôt do that. When I mix in a bit of the Australian Gold, I still don‚Äôt get dryness‚Äîjust a lovely glow. I can‚Äôt get the same effect with any other sunscreen; only this one works for me.

The Dr. G Green sunscreen doesn‚Äôt cause dryness either, but it doesn‚Äôt mix well to reduce the white cast; it turns almost lavender when I try. It blends out ok to remove the white cast but still, I never have a day where I think "my skin looks good today" when I wear it. I‚Äôve read reviews comparing the two, suggesting Dr. G Green is better for dry skin, but that‚Äôs not true. I‚Äôve never had drier skin than I do now at 56, and many products dry it out so much that I can‚Äôt even use regular cleansers anymore. I have to stick to oily pastes like Clinique‚Äôs Take the Day Off Cleansing Balm and follow up with castor oil! If this sunscreen wasn‚Äôt meant for dry skin, I‚Äôd know, but I have no issues with it. At the same time, it‚Äôs not oily or shiny.

Overall, I just look better with this one, and I always have a good skin day when I wear it. It‚Äôs the only sunscreen I keep using and repurchasing. I really hope you stay in business because I can‚Äôt understand why you don‚Äôt have tons of five-star reviews and have to give away free products!

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content:
I have very oily skin (though I am not very acne prone) and my whole skincare regimen is about keeping that that oil and shine at bay. I've incorporated this toner into my routine day and night ‚Äì right after cleansing ‚Äì and really helps with keeping your pores clear and helping prep your skin for whatever other products you're going to use afterward.

Protip: A little goes a long way! The instructions say to "soak a cotton pad" but you can just do a few shakes of the bottle or even better use your hands to pat gently over your whole face.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
content:
I have combo skin that can lean oily or dry, depending on a million different factors, and that can seemingly change from day to day. I like using toners that actually do work to help bring pH balance back to my skin.

I would say that my skin can be very fickle, especially depending on how intact my barrier is, as I do have mild type 1 rosacea. Tea tree oil is normally a pretty helpful ingredient for me, while niacinamide is something I can't handle in larger concentrations when my skin is flaring up (which usually just amounts to mild-severe flushing for me on my cheeks/around eyes/nose that does calm down once I escape the trigger and use calming products.)

I know many people with skin like mine have turned to Dr. Jart+ products, so I figured I'd try this toner and hopefully my review can help someone else like me.

The Teatreement toner does (obviously) smell of tea tree oil, but that fades as the toner is absorbed. It's definitely a watery toner, so I used cotton rounds and/or spray bottle for application. The directions do say to use on clean, damp skin. It does not state the percentage of niacinamide, but I will say that it is the 2nd ingredient listed on the box, after water (see my photo for the full ingredient list.)

This does also contain quite a few hydrating and nourishing ingredients like glycerin, centella, allantoin, green tea, ceramides, etc. There's also salicylic acid about halfway down the list.

I've used this 3 times so far, twice in the AM and once as part of my PM routine. Because it's Summer and hot, my flares have been happening more frequently, so I've been trying really hard to keep them in check.

This toner did not burn or tingle upon application, it soaks in nicely, did provide some calming effects, and it hasn't felt drying. It also has not caused any irritation, which was a pleasant surprise. I haven't been using it daily though, mostly because I don't want to press my luck. It pairs well with my other skincare products and makeup.

I like that it does have a nice ingredient list and isn't harsh. I don't know that it'd be good for my skin for daily use, but it's something I definitely appreciate having around for when I need it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content:
Since I got introduced to the Dr. Jart+ cosmetic product. I decided to try this toner. I did a test patch on my arms to check if it would cause me any allergies and I can safely say that this toner is non-allergenic.

I followed my daily routine - cleanse, toner, serum, and finally moisturize.  I soaked the cotton ball with this toner and applied it around my neck first to make sure I would not have any irritation.  If you love the tea tree scent then you may want to try this toner.  You can really smell the nice essence of the tea tree.  However, some people who prefer unscented may be turned off by this toner since the tea tree smell is not subtle.

The toner is easy to apply and good for dry skin since I can feel some moisturizing/oily ingredients.  The toner is okay in my opinion and experience however, the price is steep and pricier than the competition.

Overall, this is a toner you may want to check out if you are fond of tea trees.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

content: I love Dr. Jart+ products and this toner is no exception. It has a slight scent but nothing too overwhelming, and I appreciate that it doesn't make my face feel sticky after it quickly dries. I would recommend this to anyone having hormonal skin balance issues!

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

First off, the Tea Tree scent is STRONG!!!! Again, I‚Äôm not a fan of that scent but I feel like even someone who IS a fan of the scent may think it‚Äôs too strong as well.

The toner itself didn‚Äôt do much for my skin. It actually left my skin looking oily but feeling really dry. It says it‚Äôs supposed to remove excess oil without disturbing your skins moisture barrier and I do not feel that was true with this product and my skin at all.

Everyone‚Äôs skin is different so this may be someone else‚Äôs next favorite toner, but it‚Äôs not for me..

That being said, I tried another product by this company that I absolutely love and will continue to use, so maybe it is just this product.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

To be fair, I‚Äôm not particularly a fan of the scent of tea tree products. I know the benefits, I just wish they could make it less strong in the scent department.
This toner goes on easily and a little goes a long way. I was disappointed to find it‚Äôs a little oily, and with combination skin that leans oily in the summer this is not something I‚Äôm looking for in a product. It also dries down kind of sticky and tacky. That paired with the smell just did not make it a must have product for me.
I also have sensitive skin, and while I didn‚Äôt experience any bad irritation the product did burn areas where my skin was more dry. I‚Äôm not sure what long term use would do, but if you‚Äôre sensitive to harsher products I‚Äôd advise using with caution and to go slowly.

title: Dr.Jart+ Teatreement Face Toner for Oily Skin | Korean Skin Care, 4.05 Fl Oz

Ingredients: water (aqua/eau), niacinamide, propanediol, pentylene glycol, glycerin, octyldodeceth-16, butylene glycol, sodium citrate, portulaca oleracea extract, melaleuca alternifolia (tea tree) leaf oil, ethylhexylglycerin, citric acid, disodium EDTA, hydrogenated lecithin, 1,2-hexanediol, glycyrrhiza glabra (licorice) root extract, ficus carica (fig) fruit extract, centella asiatica extract, allantoin, melaleuca alternifolia (tea tree) leaf extract, camellia sinensis (green tea) leaf extract, gloiopeltis furcata extract, ceramide NP, salicylic acid, hamamelis virginiana (witch hazel) extract, camphor, anthemis nobilis (chamomile) flower extract, aloe barbadensis leaf extract, caprylyl glycol, capryloyl glycine, hexylene glycol, carthamus tinctorius (safflower) seed oil, sarcosine, tocopherol, cinnamomum zeylanicum bark extract, silica, caprylic/capric triglyceride, phospholipids, glycine soja (soybean) sterols, 4-terpineol <ILNDJ006>.

I have sensitive skin, including psoriasis on my face and also am prone to periorbital dermatitis- so I have to be cautious about skin care products, and I find often that green-tinted 'color correction' products flare up the dermatitis. I appreciate that this formula isn't greasy, so it doesn't battle with make-up if I want to use this as a base layer.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024
content:
Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 fl oz

Lightweight, color-correcting serum

I've used Dr. Jart products in the past and it has always been a solid product line. A few years, I was using a Dr. Jart tinted moisturizer with SPF. It worked nicely, but had a pinkish tone and went on pretty thick. I really love this new color-correcting serum, as it's lightweight and color-corrects to your own skin tone. It goes on thin and leaves the tiniest bit of a healthy sheen without being shiny or greasy. The green tone disappears like magic and balances out any redness in your skin. It dries quickly and feels like normal skin. I haven't tried foundation over it, but I think it would work just fine. The color-correcting properties work so well I haven't felt like I needed it! Very cool product and a painless way to wear your daily sunscreen.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content: Can't complain about Dr. Jart products, they're solid and contain real ingredients, no processed ones

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content:
I am reviewing the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35, 1.01 fl oz. This is an interesting serum that goes on after a moisturizer. It is tinted green to help neutralize redness. I found the effect subtle but nice.

This is a fragrance free product, but it is lightly scented from the ingredients. It does have some oils that might increase sun sensitivity, so it is nice that the product includes SPF. Since only a few drops of this product are used in an application, it is nowhere near thick enough to provide actual sun protection. (The SPF is fairly low, too.) Still, I'll take all the SPF I can get. Layered with a sunscreen, it is a little extra protection.

This is a nice serum if redness is one of your skincare concerns.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
content: My nose and cheeks have a slight redness to them and this really helps to tone that down. I don't wear foundation and I have tried other products to help cover the red but this one is working best for me. It doesn't looks weird on me or like I am wearing a cover up on my face. It just take that dreaded redness away.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
content: I love using this when I just want to neutralize my pink undertones without using makeup. The formula is smooth and evens out well when rubbed in. Doesn‚Äôt leave my skin feeling dry although I wouldn‚Äôt describe it as being ‚Äúextra‚Äù hydrating.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
content: I put this on top of my moisturizer and it does color correct for redness. It feels a little chalky when you first put it on but that disappears. I would agree that this probably isn't a great product/sunscreen for a day at the beach.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
content: I have tried a few different brands to tone down my redness on my face. Some have been too thick and make me look way too white and others did nothing. This is perfect. It blends in completely, you can't even tell I am wearing anything. The redness is almost completely gone after I apply. I don't wear a lot of foundation so I've been using this quite a bit. You only need a small amount. Very very happy with it!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
content: Really like this product. I have pretty smooth skin, but my cheeks are prone to redness and this product helps to neutralize the red and present a more evenly colored skin tone. It only takes a couple drops, and it quickly turns from green to skin tone. It glides across my skin and doesn't take long to set before I can brush translucent powder on my T-zone. This has been really nice for summer because it provides SPF and allows me to happily skip foundation except for specific occasions. I still have some redness in my cheeks after application, it doesn't completely eliminate it, but it does tone it down significantly without making me look washed out.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content:
Covering my redness has always been the hardest and most frustrating part of my makeup routine since I developed rosacea. I've tried countless products, but have never really been satisfied with the results until now.

I've heard others sing the praises of Dr. Jart+ products for awhile now, so I absolutely jumped at this opportunity. The Tiger Grass Camo Drops wear so beautifully. The formula is lighter than the tiger grass cream, which is perfect for the hot, humid weather we've been having. It doesn't melt off my face at all.

I am 35, so I do have some fine lines, and I'm really pleased with how little this settles into those lines. I have combo skin, oily T zone with dryer cheeks, nose, and eye area. I take good care of my skin and try to keep my moisture barrier intact to prevent my skin from being so reactive. I typically can't tolerate higher percentages of niacinamide, and though these drops do contain niacinamide, it has not caused any irritation at all. I'm so happy that it hasn't, because the coverage these provide is top notch! It hasn't dried my skin out either.

These drops have a thin, serum like consistency. They do have that faint herbal scent (I believe it may be tea tree?) but it isn't noticeable once it dries down. A little goes a very long way, but the coverage is buildable. I'm actually pale enough that I can get away with not wearing foundation over the drops, but I did test that out for review purposes, and it layered really well underneath. No pilling or separation, didn't accentuate pores or dry patches. It dries down fairly quickly, but I've found it best to let dry completely before adding foundation or concealer.

The coverage is very long lasting, and it dries down to a pretty, dewy looking finish. If you aren't wearing foundation on top, the dewy effect can be toned down easily with some setting powder/spray if that's preferred. It plays well with all the other makeup and skincare products I've tried with it.

After using this, my skin tone was so much more even than I'm used to that I was like "wow, I actually do need to wear blush and bronzer with this" lol. There's a swatch in one of my pics, taken inside with overhead light on and in front of a window.

For my fellow flushing peeps: I flush as soon as I step outside. So I can apply this when my cheeks aren't even that red and step outside, feel my cheeks flaring, but you still can't really see the redness peeking out. No other product has done such a fantastic job of hiding the flushing. I also do flare a little around my eyes, so there were a couple days I used this rather than concealer for my under eye area. It works great, but I did feel that it dried out that thin under eye skin a slight bit. It didn't do that to my cheeks though.

In conclusion, I am converted. This stuff is amazing.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024
content: Works perfect on my redness as a base under makeup, or just as sunscreen + skincare.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2024
content: It works so well on my skin. Just a few drops and it leaves a nice natural glow and tint to my skin, while getting rid of red patches. Love that it protects from the sun! This does go on like a serum, a little oily, but makes my skin feel really nice. I wear MAC N5 shade and this product matches with my skin perfectly.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content: A little natural lemony fragrance that doesn't irritate. Works well and doesn't feel heavy on your skin. Great addition of SPF to help protect your skin. It relieves redness and cancels redness out. I feel the price point per ounce is the only setback in my experience.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content:
I'm done with foundation!
I have ruddy skin and need coverage. This product goes over my entire face and goes on green, but quickly matches my skin tone. I'm fair/medium.
It does have SPF but I still apply a high SPF on my face and neck before applying this product.
This product is a nice lotion texture. I have oily skin so I don't need a creamy, moisturizing product. This lotion formula feels and looks amazing; no greasy feeling although i feel a sense of some moisture because its not too drying. It applies on, smoothly.
I'm on my 2nd bottle.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
content: WOW! I am truly amazed by this Dr. Jart+Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops! I love that the face serum has SPF 35 which is my go to product when I am running quick errands and do not want to put on any makeup. The serum is definitely not close to being full coverage but adds a nice subtle tint to your skin and a bit of a glow. Love it!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
content: First, let me say that the moisturizer that you use matters. You are supposed to apply this sunscreen/skin tone serum on top of your moisturizer. The first time I ever used it, my moisturizer pilled. Next time, I tried a different moisturizer, and voila - no pilling! So the moisturizer matters, and you may have to test out some different things until you find the combo that works for you. I have never used a product like this before, but I really like it because I don‚Äôt like to wear heavy foundation, but I have some sunspots and redness that I like to lightly even out. This product helps me do that. I could pretty much just wear this serum without any foundation, but I have not worked myself up to that level yet.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content:
This is a really good tinted SPF. I use it over top of my moisturizer but without makeup. I stopped doing a full face, and this is great for me. It does go on whitish, but then blends to match your skin tone (I am a medium skin tone, and this looks flawless on me). It takes a bit to rub in and you only literally need 2-3 drops to cover your face.

I swim almost daily in the warmer weather, but this is terrible for the pool. It kind of slides off and doesn't offer protection (and will be visible on your towel, swimsuit, anywhere your face may have touched, etc. when you dry off.) It does wash out without any pretreatment - my gear is not stained like if I was wearing a foundation... but I do not recommend for pool days, even though it's easy and makes your skin look great.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content: I love these drops - they are a thicker consistency but blend really well. It goes on green but quickly blends to match your skin tone leaving your skin looking more even toned and with a dewy finish. I have pretty golden-tan colored skin in the summer and this works perfectly for my skin tone and makes my skin look more refreshed and hydrated while blurring some of the imperfections and redness. I'm sad that my jar came less than half full - I'm hoping that was just a mistake and not how every jar comes because it is expensive but well worth it if it works for your skin tone.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content:
I wanted to love this product because it has SPF AND it color changes from green, but it is a strong NO for me because it makes my skincare peel in a very bad way. It didn't lay over my skincare and immediately made my products peel. I waited for my products to completely dry before applying this product but as soon as I started applying this started my products and this started to peel. In addition, the base gave me a white cast which was probably a cool neutral undertone over an actually white cast, but my face was noticeably cool neutral, which is not my color family. Unfortunately because it makes my skincare peel I can't wear it alone to just tint because of the peeling and color.

Wear over time, my face looked a bit greasy which wasn't ideal and I had to blot multiple times a day.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content:
DrJart has different green based redness relievers. This one is a thick serum with a dropper, and the other one is a dense cream version. I honestly like them both and don't have preference to one versus the other, as they both work for me.
So this serum is a little thick, but it rubs into the skin and becomes almost invisible. Less is more here. Don't rely on this product for sunscreen, you must use other sunscreen underneath. My facial skin is very red, so I'm a prime candidate to wear this product. A thin layer, worked well into the skin, doesn't stay green. It just melts into my skin and works away the red and irritated appearance. I followed with my foundation on top and needed to use less of it because my skin wasn't red anymore. I also wore this product alone with no foundation and my face looked looked normal, only without redness. I really love this product and highly recommend it. Less is more, use only a small dab on cheek and forehead and rub rub rub it in for best results.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content: I really love the drop way better than the cream. The cream is a bit heavier and gets greasy on my skin. The formula of these drops is so light and comfortable to wear but also have the same benefits and appearance. I don't use foundation or much makeup but I love how I can use this and get out the door looking less inflamed and having more even skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2024
content: This goes on like a moisturizer. Leaves skin hydrated. I am fair with a ruddy complexion. This evens out my face but I still use the heavier color correcting treatment on my nose.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content: I wanted to love this bad. It looks SO good initially. It covered up my redness super well and the finish was beautiful. Unfortunately, I noticed that it clung to my dry spots and became patchy after an hour.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content:
Dr Jart's Cicapair Tiger Grass serum is a physical sunscreen with a few extras.

Unlike most sunscreens, it's packaged in a glass bottle with a dropper that dispenses the serum. It is heavy for a serum, with a somewhat glue-like texture, and has a natural fragrance that's faintly medicinal and not at all objectionable to me.

Because this is SPF 35, it provides good protection. The fluid dries quickly and evens out skin tone. I would not say that it gives me any kind of glow. On the contrary, the effect is rather masklike. I would not wear it to a Fourth of July party, but it's fine for most days.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2024
content:
Take this review with a grain of salt because i do believe that this Dr Jart Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops has its target audience, I mean there is a reason that the OG Dr Jart Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment has a cult following. For the right person this stuff would be awesome, I mean it‚Äôs basically a really sheer color correcting tinted serum with SPF.

The issue is that I have fair/light skin with a cool undertone. And just like the OG one on me this ends up looking literally orange once it‚Äôs massaged in. It‚Äôs like this orange/yellow/green hue that just doesn‚Äôt look good on me at all.

Now if you have light-medium, medium, or even medium-deep skin then this would likely work wonderfully for you, but on me it looks horrible.

And it‚Äôs a shame too because I really like the finish and how it feels on my skin. And the fact that it has spf on it is wonderful. And it also cuts down on redness wonderfully which I could definitely use. It‚Äôs just simply not made for my skin color unfortunately.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024
content: So the first time I used it I didn‚Äôt shake it up and thought that it did nothing. You really need to shake it good for the product to work. That being said, I felt like the coverage could‚Äôve been a little better but this is my first time using color corrector and it did help and it‚Äôs lightweight so doesn‚Äôt feel like it will cause acne or is too heavy

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2024

It does tend to stick to any dry spots on the face so I physically exfoliate my skin before applying moisturizer then apply the serum before the moisturizer dries too much. I find that I still have to use some concealer on spots that are more discolored.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

If you know you‚Äôre not allergic to any ingredients in this product it will be great for you. I‚Äôd recommend patch testing before you put it on your whole face though

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2024
content: Loves it!!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Tiger Grass Camo Drops Tinted Face Serum SPF 35 | Color Corrector | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

content: I found that putting this under my skin care routine before makeup when I have blemished that are red has helped to completely conceal them once makeup is applied! Really a great makeup product that lives us to the hype, as someone who deals with occasional acne and blemishes this is a product that makes my makeup days better when dealing with acne. Really recommend it!

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
content:
I am reviewing: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser, 5.07 fl oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

Instructions say to use a grape amount and to lather that, but I‚Äôm telling you that a grape amount I‚Äôd wasteful, it‚Äôs far too much! Half that has been perfect for me and my face. It lathers up and leaves my face feeling absolutely incredibly. I‚Äôm talking clean, stripped, smoothed, glowing. Not deprived of anything necessary, but cleansed and bare canvas. Just perfect.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
content:
So far I‚Äôm enjoying this Dr. Jart cleanser. I have neither found it to cause any irritation nor dryness. The cleanser does a good job at removing makeup and cleanses the skin thoroughly.
This is a thick gel cleanser with small blue exfoliating beads. Personally, from my research, I‚Äôm not a fan of manual exfoliants like this. I find chemical exfoliants are better for the skin as manual exfoliants can be harsh and damaging to the skin. However, these beads do seem to be incredibly gentle.
Besides simply cleansing the skin well, I haven‚Äôt noticed any miracles or differences in my skin. I‚Äôm not entirely sure the value is on par with the price. That being said, I would recommend this product if you want something you know is of good quality. This is a brand I would trust.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024
content: This is a very thick and concentrated face wash that doesn't lather a lot. it's definitely not stripping but seemed to remove even my sunscreen. not as well as my oil balm, but way better than typical foaming cleansers. I love this company and they always have great products that are very effective.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

content: I am nearing 50 and have combination skin that is not sensitive. However, this burned when I used it. Not only that, but using toner afterwards revealed that it left a lot of dirt on my face. I did not feel that it was moisturizing, but my skin did feel smooth after use and after I applied my daily moisturizer.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
