content: This cleanser leaves my skin feeling squeaky clean but once it‚Äôs completely dry it actually feels silky soft, which is surprising and I love it. I can get a really good lather after massaging it for a bit, and even quicker if I use my gentle rotating face brush. Should last long enough to make it a decent value for terrific ingredients.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
content: This gel formula contains little micro beads. They call them mint, but I'm not really sure why, since I couldn't find mint listed on the ingredients, and I didn't notice any mint fragrance to them. The gel doesn't seem to have much of a fragrance either. A small dime size amount of this goes a long way. It seems to clean well and rinses off easily. I got a light foam when using.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
content: I‚Äôm confused by a few things with this product. It said the little capsules are mint but I get no mint vibes or scent when they burst. Also, there‚Äôs no way I‚Äôm using a grape size amount of this for my face. That is way too much! It took forever to lather and was just an awful experience. I used a small pea to dime sized amount the next time and it lathered a lot better with warm water. It takes some rinsing to get off your face too, this stuff wants to attach to your skin quite badly! Overall, it does clean but I much prefer other brands as this one takes a lot more effort just to wash my face.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024
content:
Very luxurious feeling face wash. Lathers up very fast and the small micro beads help exfoliate without feeling too harsh. I have sensitive skin, and this wash leaves my face feeling clean and refreshed without over drying. I really like that there are no strong smells. I hate feeling like I am washing my face with perfume!
Overall, I like this face wash and how my sensitive skin feels. I will absolutely buy again.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content: The cleanser didn't have much of a scent. It was very gentle and cleaned my skin well. It wasn't drying and had a good amount of lather. It removed most of the traces makeup the first time. I did have to go a second round for my mascara but that's normal for me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
content:
Instructions say to use grape-size amount. After seeing the thick, clear gel, I couldn't force myself to use that amount. Half that amount was too much, and hard to lather and hard to rinse off. So, Like other reviewers before me: A dab will do it, and provide satisfactory results.

There is no fragrance and just a minimum of scrub material. The grains are so few and far between that I don't see the benefit of including them. But the grains do provide a bit of stimulation. If a good amount of scrubbing particles is a must in your cleanser, look for a different product.

My skin felt clean, not necessarily refreshed. Dense, almost sticky, gel that turns to a thick, small-bubbled white foam, which takes some time to rinse off. Definitely kept my pores tight and refined-looking. No tightness, no irritation, no redness, no dryness. Soft bottle stands on end and no messy dripping.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
content: This is a great cleanser. I didn't use the recommended amount, because I thought that it was too much. I used a smaller amount, in the shower and was able to clean both face and neck. The cleanser is gentle and leaves my skin smooth and refreshed.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
content:
This is a wonderful cleanser! I love that it has what appear to be little serum beads in it. I assume that they are bursting, either that or they are jojoba beads. Regardless, it's a nice touch, though I do wish there were more! This cleanser is VERY thick... in the best way possible, you truly only need a tiny bit. This ~5oz bottle is going to last me an eternity, and I certainly don't mind that. My only note, and reason for the reduction of a star, is that I am not finding it to be particularly foamy. Typcially with a foaming cleanser I would emulsify it in my hands before rubbing it into my face, but it seems like, because of the beads, that's not how this product is intended to be used (I did not read the directions, I just tried it both ways). But, I didn't find it to foam really at all when applied to my face. Stayed more of a gel consistency. That said, I didn't find it to foam too much between my hands either... so I'm just not sure! Maybe it is just a very gentle lather.

Dr. Jart is a great brand, I've tried their products many times over the years! Every single one I have liked, this product being no exception.

My skin type is normal, so while it felt clean after using this, it wasn't left feeling quite as comfortable as with my cream to mousse cleansers. The backside of the package says this is for *rough skin*, whatever that means.

The one disappointment is that I have not seen any improvement in the appearance of my pores, which are the same size as ever and just as prone to getting clogged as before I started using this cleanser.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024

I've since changed to using it in the shower and now I look forward to using it. Only a small amount is required, even less than pea size, so the tube will last a long time. I mix it with water in my hands and when I massage into my skin I can feel the tiny mint capsules dissolve. To me it has a light citrus/grapefruit scent which fades quickly. In the shower it is much easier to rinse off, leaving my skin clear and face feeling extremely soft.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy Renewing Foaming Face Wash Cleanser with Glycerin | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

It does a fantastic job of cleaning my face without stripping it and causing it to be extremely dry, which I like like a lot. date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
content: When stressed I bite my lips. They become an uncomfortable dry, sore mess. There many, many different lip balms in my draw in all price points. This is my absolute favorite. Tip: When my lips are especially sore I layer an occlusive lip balm over this one and they heal quickly.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Jelly Lip Balm with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.23 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
content: I had a hard time convincing myself to purchase a lip balm for 16 dollars but I have very dry lips and a terrible habit of making my lips bleed by peeling the skin off my lips. Weird I know but it's an anxious habit I've dealt with my entire life which seems to be exacerbated by the fact I have psoriasis. I was looking around for lip balms that were super moisturizing that would prevent dry skin on my lips and therefore alleviate my need to peel the skin from my lips and from the articles I read I gathered that something with ceramides would be helpful and let me tell you in the month since I bought this I've definitely noticed a difference. My lips stay hydrated far longer. There's far less dry skin so I don't feel the need nearly as much to remove the dry skin. I would definitely recommend this product to someone with dry skin issues on their lips because it's definitely helping me.

My wife has commented that my lips are softer and she had no idea I was using this, so it must be working!

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Jelly Lip Balm with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.23 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Jelly Lip Balm with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.23 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Jelly Lip Balm with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.23 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content: I do think this lip balm is a bit on the expensive side, but at the same time I do really love it. It wears so well that I really don't mind the price. title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Jelly Lip Balm with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.23 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024
content:
This lip balm is very comfortable to wear. It does not have a noticeable scent or taste. It is thick, but thins out as you apply it to your lips. The thicker consistency is helpful for controlling how much I apply at a time; I can squeeze out more if needed, without accidentally getting too much product at once. It's not sticky at all, and it makes my lips look slightly glossy. It works well underneath lipstick, as well. It wears about as long as an average lip balm before needing to be reapplied.

This lip balm does a fairly good job of moisturizing my lips. I've worn this consistently when my lips have been chapped, and I've noticed that they have gotten smoother more quickly than they would have without using it. However, the tube is small, and the lip balm does not contain SPF. I've tried other lip balms that perform similarly and are a better value (or at least contain SPF). So, I'm not sure I will purchase a new tube when I run out of this, but it's still a good lip balm. I'd recommend it if you're sensitive to fragrances or are otherwise just looking for a comfortable lip balm.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Skin Barrier Face Serum Toner with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content:
Can we first get over the stigma of men using face product? I live in sunny climate; during the summer the UV index is often pegged at ‚Äú11‚Äù (the maximum) for many hours. This takes its toll on your face, even as I typically use facial product containing SPF as a critical part of my daily routine. So why this product when it doesn‚Äôt contain SPF? My dermatologist recommended I upgrade to mineral-based SPF, which means separate product for moisturizer before SPF.

This is first product I have used with Ceramides; however I have read about this and wanted to try. I use is after showering and shaving, before SPF (now mineral-based); as directed by much of what I have read. This product goes on thin; a little spreads over a large area. You definitely need less than you think. As a moisturizer, I like it. As anti-aging, too early to tell. I am definitely going to stick with this through a full bottle though...

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Skin Barrier Face Serum Toner with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content:
Unlock the secret to luminous, hydrated skin with this transformative serum-toner hybrid that takes your skincare routine to new heights.

Key benefits -
‚Ä¢ Strengthens the skin barrier with Ceramide NP
‚Ä¢ Deeply hydrates and softens with Panthenol
‚Ä¢ Preps skin for the next step in your routine
‚Ä¢ Ideal for all skin types, especially dry complexions

This innovative Ceramidin Serum Toner combines the nourishing power of a serum with the balancing benefits of a toner for a one-step skincare essential. The rich, silky formula immediately quenches thirsty skin, replenishing essential ceramides to reinforce the skin's natural protective barrier. Skin is left feeling plump, supple, and prepped for maximum absorption of your favorite moisturizers and serums.

Whether you have dry, dehydrated skin or simply want to elevate your routine, this Ceramidin Serum Toner is a game-changing addition. The soothing, nourishing formula works for all skin types, providing a boost of hydration and strengthening the skin's natural defenses against environmental stressors. Experience a spa-like glow and renewed radiance with just a few drops - your complexion will thank you.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Skin Barrier Face Serum Toner with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024

Most of my other toners and serums containing ingredients that I can‚Äôt use at the same time as a retinoid, such as vitamin C. So I use those products during the day, and I‚Äôve started using this serum toner in the evening to combat the flaky and irritated skin that retinoids can cause. The ceramides and panthenol are extremely soothing and I can layer this by patting it in. It helps to soothe my skin and combat any side effects from retinoid use. I sometimes use this during the day as well, about 1 hour before I put on makeup and it helps my skin plump up and ready for makeup application. I really enjoy this and would highly recommend it for dry skin and people who use retinol/retinoids.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair‚Ñ¢ Sensitive Skin Serum Face Mask for Redness | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content:
So apparently my sensitive skin is even too sensitive for this face mask. For context, I use a number of Dr. Jart's other products, specifically those that target color correction. Have always loved the quality of the products and they have always worked great for me.

When I saw this face mask released, I immediately knew I wanted to order it. My skin care is very limited due to my sensitive skin, and overall I struggle to redness and combination skin. I was hoping this mask would reduce the redness in my face and help to even my tone a bit, as well as hydrate my dry areas.

This mask is very goopy and holds a lot of product, and took a sec to unfold to put on. I left this mask on for 15 minutes, but within the first 5 minutes I felt my skin feeling a bit irritated. I should have probably removed it then, but I thought that maybe this mask was supposed to feel like that as some skincare products will have a very slight burning/tingling feeling initially on the skin that is normal, which was not the case I believe for this mask. When I removed I patted my face dry with a hand towel, but after my face started to feel very itchy and hot I completely washed my face.

After about an hour my face is feeling normal again but it is definitely even more red from what I believe is an allergic reaction. Overall I am not sure this product works or not, but make sure to check the ingredients to see if you are allergic to anything before using.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair‚Ñ¢ Sensitive Skin Serum Face Mask for Redness | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
content: As someone with more sensitive skin, I decided to leave this mask on the lower end (15 minutes) to err on the side of caution since I have read some reviews that have problems with this product irritating their skin. My personal experience with other products that had cica in them was that I had to let my skin get used to the product for a couple of usages before the irritation went away. If it is your first time exposing your skin to the ingredient cica, it could be quite harsh hence why some people with sensitive skin mentioned that this mask irritated their skin. With usual cica topical products, those have a lower dosage of cica so I would recommend giving those products a try to see if your skin would have adverse effects to cica before applying this concentrated face mask version of cica onto your face. My skin didn't get irritated from this mask and in fact, I did notice a significant improvement in my skin's redness immediately after taking the face mask off.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair‚Ñ¢ Sensitive Skin Serum Face Mask for Redness | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair‚Ñ¢ Sensitive Skin Serum Face Mask for Redness | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
content:
Dr Jart+ Cicapair sensitive skin serum face mask is an experience! This is a single mask folded and saturated is serum in the package. When I opened the package I had to remove and open the mask in order to place it on my face. When I opened it and put it on my face it felt really cooling and there was a lot (I do mean a LOT) of serum available to my face. The face mask was a little awkward to put on and the holes sort of fit my face. My face felt a little tingly around my eyes and I am not sure if that was it being irritating or it working or from the mask itself.

I left the mask on my face for 20 minutes and when I took it off I rubbed some of the serum to my neck and then let the rest of the serum absorb into my face. It took quite a while for the rest of the serum to absorb. It did not bother my skin after I removed the mask (so it may have been the way the mask was cut) and it did leave my skin well hydrated. I did use the mask in the evening so I was able to let it soak in overnight when I didn't add anything else to my face in order to get the most benefit from it.

The mask was ok. Not my favorite product and it was a bit difficult to use.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask‚Ñ¢ Soothing Hydra Solution‚Ñ¢ Face Mask for Visibly Irritated Skin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
content:
I do a multi-step K-Beauty-type routine using a lot of K-Beauty products along with a few products made elsewhere, and masks are one of the steps I very often leave out. In particular, I leave out sheet masks as they are more 'stuff' to toss in a landfill, and as well, I don't have the patience to sit around with something stuck to my face.

But the price of sheet masks do not make sense to me in the realm of my skincare routine. Consider that the price of this one mask (at time of this review) is $9.50. If you use it once a week, that's $38 a month for a mask. I'd rather take that $38 and put it towards a really good serum that I can use for multiple months.

This mask, like many others, is okay. The amount of time it sits on the skin may or may not help it to penetrate better. I know that the allantoin in it is an anti-inflammatory and may help with dark spots, but so do really good serums with allantoin, or niacinamide, or vitamin c.

It's slimy feeling and much of the serum goes to waste unless you try to use every bit elsewhere on your body. It will feel tacky to the touch for some time. I didn't have any irritation from it at all on my rosacea-prone skin.

I do a Pat & Press with my skincare and I did try that both while the mask was on and after I took it off. That does help the serum to absorb and helps not to tug at the face, and as well, warms the skin that may help with absorption.

They did not list the ingredients so I have no idea what is in this mask to make it worth almost $10. I wish skincare brands would be better about listing the ingredients.

I'll pass on this one.

title: Dr.Jart+ Dermask‚Ñ¢ Soothing Hydra Solution‚Ñ¢ Face Mask for Visibly Irritated Skin | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content:
This little green tube has become a staple in my post-sunburn routine. The Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Treatment is a lightweight gel cream that goes on smoothly and absorbs quickly. It takes the redness out of my irritated skin without any stinging or burning, which is a major plus.

Here's what I like:

‚Ä¢Soothing relief: This stuff calms my skin down fast, especially after a day out in the sun.
‚Ä¢Lightweight: It doesn't feel heavy or greasy under moisturizer, which is great in the summer.
‚Ä¢Gentle: No irritation on my sensitive skin.

A couple of minor drawbacks:

‚Ä¢Price: A little on the expensive side for a small tube.
‚Ä¢Scent: Has a faint herbal scent that might not be for everyone.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Face Treatment for Visibly Irritated Skin | Skin Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content:
As one who still has issues from time to time in my senior years, I still keep on hand something to help address those issues that I was supposed to have left behind in my teenage years. I have mature combination skin that still, on occasion, gets oily and develops an eruption that needs to be dealt with. Usually just along the nose area. It's quite common for me to use skincare products with lots of moisturization along most of my face and something for more youthful skin along my nose. Then there are days when I use the oil sopping products all over my face to clear everything away and give my skin an oil break before starting all over again with a more intense moisturization regimen.

This cream is fantastic for me to use for spot work, especially along my nose. Not only does it help to control excess sebum production, but it also helps to minimize pore size. What I really love is that it goes to work right away to settle down any sort of disruption that's taking place. It's so clean and soothing. Does not dry out the skin nor strip away too many of the essential oils either. Leaves the skin along my nose in perfect balance. Plus it immediately goes to work to shrink and destroy that eruption that is starting to develop. After application, you can run your finger along the applied area and feel a thin layer of the set gel that stays in place to continue to protect your skin. Stays and works for many hours on end for your protection.

Oh, how I wish that I had this stuff many years ago. Meanwhile, I'm very happy that I have it now.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Face Treatment for Visibly Irritated Skin | Skin Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
content:
As I've gotten older I've started getting different facial issues including wrinkles (of course), uneven skin tone, and redness. The redness is uneven too and comes and goes.

Per the instructions you can use this on certain areas of the face or on the entire face. Due to the small amount and high price I opted to only use on the redness areas of my face which is the most area I feel self conscious.

The product goes on easy and absorbs in to the skin like a typical face lotion. After approximately 2 weeks, to my surprise, I was visibly able to notice a difference in the redness on my face. It almost completely went away. I would say the redness is now 90% less but also less patchy as well.

Overall, I've been quite impressed with this product but my one negative is the price. For what you're getting here with the small bottle, I'm not sure it's a great value for the money. Even though my redness has mostly went away my biggest question is will my redness come back like before if I stop using the product? I'm hoping it's gone but only time will tell. If the redness does come back this means I'd need to use this product all the time for as long as I didn't want the redness on my face. But on the other hand if my redness doesn't come back, well, I'd consider this product a success.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Face Treatment for Visibly Irritated Skin | Skin Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024
content:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I'm always on the lookout for effective solutions for irritated and sensitive skin, and the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Face Treatment has become my go-to for calming inflamed complexions. This Korean skincare brand has created a concentrated treatment serum that delivers targeted relief to stressed skin. Here's an honest review of my experience:

Soothing and Calming:
One of the standout features of this face treatment is its ability to instantly soothe and calm irritated skin. Enriched with centella asiatica, a powerful skin-repairing ingredient, this serum provides a comforting sensation to inflamed and reactive complexions. My skin felt relieved and comforted, especially during periods of sensitivity and redness.

Skin Barrier Repair:
The formula is designed to support the skin's natural barrier, helping to strengthen and protect it. Centella asiatica, a key ingredient, promotes the regeneration of the skin's protective barrier, aiding in the recovery process. Over time, I noticed an improvement in my skin's overall resilience and health.

Lightweight and Quick-Absorbing:
The serum has a lightweight and fluid texture, absorbing quickly into the skin. It provides an immediate soothing sensation without leaving any greasy or sticky residue. My skin felt refreshed and balanced, with no heavy or oily sensation often associated with richer creams.

Redness Reduction:
The formula effectively targets redness and inflamed skin, a common concern for sensitive skin types. The combination of centella asiatica and other calming ingredients helps alleviate redness, providing a more even and calm complexion. With regular use, I noticed a visible improvement in the overall appearance of my skin's redness.

Suitable for Sensitive Skin:
As a K-beauty enthusiast with sensitive skin, I appreciate that this face treatment is carefully formulated to be gentle and non-irritating. Free from potential irritants like parabens and fragrances, it ensures a safe and soothing experience for even the most delicate complexions.

Overall Complexion Enhancement:
Not only does this treatment address redness and irritation, but it also enhances the overall appearance of the skin. My skin looked healthier and more radiant, with a noticeable improvement in texture and tone. It created a smooth and even canvas for subsequent skincare products.

Overall Recommendation:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I highly recommend the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair So Soothing Face Treatment to anyone seeking a calming and repairing solution for irritated and sensitive skin. The concentrated formula, enriched with centella asiatica, delivers targeted relief, enhances the skin's barrier, and reduces redness. It's a must-have in your skincare arsenal for times when your complexion needs soothing relief.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair‚Ñ¢ Sensitive Skin Face Moisturizer for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
content:
I have mixed feelings about this product, especially given its price of $30 per ounce. I'm also very wary of products that promise instant results, and this moisturizer did not live up to its claims of reducing redness. I have sensitive skin prone to redness from various causes, including rosacea flare-ups, but I saw no improvement (in terms of amount of redness) after using this product. It also didn't help the redness from other forms of irritation, such as facial acne, slightly damaged skin, or sunburn.

I am also rather confused on exactly what this product is meant for. It mentions it's safe to use after laser treatment, but does not mention that as a "requirement"; so I assumed anyone can use this, laser treated or not. Based on my lack of results, I assume this was only meant to reduce redness from a laser treatment then. I also do not like how thick this moisturizer is. This is already an expensive product, and since it is so thick it causes you to use more of the product to get an even coat over the face since it does not spread as well as a thinner/lighter moisturizer would.

Personally, I still prefer my Olay facial moisturizer over this Dr.Jart+ moisturizer. Olay's is less expensive, spreads more easily, and feels more refreshing after use. The Dr.Jart+ moisturizer does seem to last longer though, without the need of reapplying as often. Both moisturizers provide moisture without leaving a greasy feeling, but at vastly different price points. I will continue to try this Dr.Jart+ moisturizer for a longer period and see if there are any further results, but so far its claims of reducing redness does not seem true and it seems no better than cheaper facial moisturizers.

Overall, for my very dry, fair, and sensitive skin, the Dr.Jart+ moisturizer does not offer enough benefits to warrant its high price. I would not recommend it when there are more affordable options available that provide equal or better results.

This scentless serum has a slightly runny gel texture that melts into the skin. My skin soaks it up fairly quickly and this serum plus a lightweight moisturizer gives my oily/combo skin enough hydration for the summertime. I'll need to add more serums and thicker creams in colder months.

I'm writing this review after using this serum for a week and I have to say that $50+ is too much for the results I saw. It's a basic hydrating/moisturizing serum and you can find much more affordable and effective serums elsewhere. I didn't notice a drastic reduction in visible redness or much of an improvement in my skin barrier beyond hydration. I guess it did feel soothing on the skin but didn't give me instant or prolonged relief when my skin was irritated.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Sensitive Skin Face Serum for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
content: This is a bit pricey, but it's a nice product. I have sensitized skin, and I'm outdoors all day in the hot sun. This goes on easily, doesn't feel greasy, and is very soothing. It's even better kept in the refrigerator.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Sensitive Skin Face Serum for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content:
If your skin is prone to environmental allergens, like mine, this line of Dr. Jart products deserves a place in your skincare regime.
Without the oily feel of hydrocortisone or the tingling sensation of some other products, this serum goes smoothly and is absorbed quickly for the next step in your routine.
There is a faintly herbal smell (you should expect this by reading the packaging), which doesn't bother me at all, but some seem not to agree. This is up to your decision, but most of the time, I don't even notice it, and when I do, it's more pleasant than irritating.
PS It's bigger than I expected.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Sensitive Skin Face Serum for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content:
Update: two things - first, the dropper stopped working after using it only a maybe 4 times and secondly I just find I don't use it that often so it's not going to be a go-to that I reach for; I won't reorder.
-----

First experience with Dr.Jart+.

I am disappointed there are no ingredients listed so I went to the Dr.Jart website and pulled them from there and put them through an ingredients checker. A couple of 'best' but most were 'good' - there were no 'worst,' but there were a few unrated/unknown ingredients.

I would expect for a 'premium' skincare product to have more 'best' ingredients. Paying a little more for skincare is fine as long as the ingredients are powerful. Though this certainly isn't as pricey as some premium skincare.

It does have allantoin, which is a 'powerhouse' ingredient in that it can maybe lighten dark spots, has anti-inflammatory properties, and helps with skin renewal and repair - not as potent as a retinoid/retinol, but good.

It felt very soothing to my rosacea-prone skin. Not sure if it calmed redness as my cheeks tend to have a little redness in the mornings and evenings. However, no irritation. And this along with my other skincare did help my rosacea-cream to absorb very smoothly.

I will want to use this for a while to see if I really like it. But first impressions are good.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Sensitive Skin Face Serum for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content: This product is now a must-have for me. I cannot make any claims but I can say that the difference I‚Äôve noticed has made it a staple in my beauty routine and in my opinion the high price tag actually is worth it for what it does for my tone and texture.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Sensitive Skin Face Serum for Redness and Barrier Repair | Korean Skin Care, 1.01 Fl Oz

Picked this up for my teenager to try. She has had success with other Dr Jart products in the past, but was not a fan of this. Her feedback was:

PROS:

CONS:

- Some days, my face seemed sticky after applying this product. (MIght have been a temperature/humidity thing as it was not always this way)

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Hydro Plump Treatment Essence with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

I have had no skin reactions to this product and it really does not have any scent to it.

I love the packaging and the bottle is very stylish and fun to have on your counter. Great for yourself or as a gift. I am sure I will be ordering this again. This is a fantastic product that I really like.

Made in Korea and distributed from the USA

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution Water Cream Glow Hydrating Face Moisturizer with Hyaluronic Acid | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content:
When I first received and used this Vital Hydra Solution by Dr. Jart, I thought it was okay. It's consistency is very light and watery and it has a pleasant scent. It did not absorb as readily as other lightweight moisturizers but I used more than a pea sized portion for each side of my face so I might have over done it a bit.

It's been over 30 minutes and my skin still feels a bit tacky from this cream. I am wondering if it is having a difficult time absorbing due to the silicones in it. This Hydro Plump Water Cream have some very nice hydrating ingredients like betaine, glycerin, sodium hyaluronate, pentavitin and niacinamide. All great for hydrating, smoothing, and protecting the skin.

What it also has is vinyl dimethicone and phenyl trimethicone. These are synthetic silicones that are put in skin care products to help the product spread easier. They also give the skin a velvety soft look and can make the skin look smoother. Another reason they've used is because they form a barrier on the skin to keep moisture in... They have a high molecular weight so literally cannot be absorbed and leave a film on the skin. Problem for some is that this barrier also keeps in bacteria, which can lead to breakouts or other issues.

Aside from that the main reason I do not like silicone based ingredients is that they are bad for the environment. Vinyl dimethicone is a microplastic that is non-biodegradable. It is also toxic to marine life.

For those reasons I will not use products with silicones in them and cannot recommend those products to others.

3.Fragrance Issues: the fragrance is strong and irritating, particularly for sensitive skin.
4. Skin Sensitivity: the product causing irritation or a stinging sensation, especially for my sensitive skin types
5. Not Effective for Deep Hydration: the cream provided initial hydration, it did not offer long-lasting moisture or help with dry patches.
6 disappointment that the product didn‚Äôt live up to its claims, especially considering its higher price point.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2024
content:
This product is definitely the most unique serum I have used. The serum bottle comes with a small freeze-dried ball of vitamin c. You drop it in the serum and shake until it dissolves. The purpose of this is to have fresh product, which is pretty cool. It is intended to use as a 7-day brightening treatment to use day and night. I did enjoy using the product, and I did notice my skin looking more bright. However, the product is still pretty pricey and isn't shelf-stable for long once activated. It is meant to be used promptly.
I think it is important to know what you are getting with this product. It is not just a normal serum.
However, I do like this brand and felt the product was effective. I just don't think I could personally justify the price.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2024
content: I was particularly targeting some crows feet and they're still there despite six solid weeks of this product. The skin looks softer but the wrinkles are still visible. Didn't like the scent either.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
content: This seems a bit of a gimmick with the way you're supposed to mix the product together--I'm not looking for a chemistry project when I use skincare so I'm not really a fan of this. It's highly possible that this product does brighten the skin a bit, but there is so little product that you'll never know with this version. The cost/ounce is also very high, so you'll have to decide if you really like this product enough to keep using it. It really didn't do much for me, so I can't really recommend it for this price.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
content: This comes in a little container with a dropper. There's this little ball of vitamin C you're supposed to drop inside to "activate" the serum by shaking/mixing it together. It does seem gentler than other vitamin C products out there. But, I don't know if I actually notice a difference in skin tone. Maybe I haven't used it for long enough or I haven't used enough product? The price isn't too bad for a vitamin C these days, but for only a 7 day (per the product) supply, it is pricier than other products. You can probably use this for more than 7 days though since it has more product than what you might use in 7 days. So I would say this would be a good vacation vitamin C product to bring along if you want.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2024
content: I like the concept of this product and that it‚Äôs a concentrated item that‚Äôs meant to be used within 30 days. It‚Äôs easy to mix together, easy to apply with a dropper, and has a liquidy consistency that worked well under makeup with no peeling. Unfortunately, after using the product for 30 days, I did not notice any improvements. I have acne marks and my skin has been looking dull lately, and I didn‚Äôt really notice any change in fine lines, dark spots, etc. Dr. Jart has some really great products where you see results quickly; however, this isn‚Äôt a product where I saw any improvements to justify the $37 price tag for a half full bottle that only lasts 1 month.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
content:
I don't know when Korean skincare became so big, but it's honestly years ahead of the rest of the world. There is always going to be a bit of a controversy since 'brightening' in Korean skincare often means 'lightening' and melanated people have taken a bit of offense to that.

Since this isn't a dark spot removing product, that's the context in which 'brightening' exists--a mild skin tone lightening.

I think you can probably get a C and Niacinimide combo for cheaper, and I know you can get a vitamin C serum for crazy cheap, so this might be marked up higher than necessary. It's a good product and works well, not slimy (unlike snail mucin, ewww) or harsh on my skin, but I'm not quite sure it's worth the price?

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
content: This bottle did last me the full 30 days of usage, applying twice a day. It's quite runny, but it goes on nicely and leaves my skin feeling hydrated and refreshed. The vitamin ball having to be added and then mixed in isn't anything I've seen before, and I'm not sure if the benefit of that, but I can attest to how well it works. My skin has lost the blotchiness and my dark spots have lightened considerably. It's a little costly, but I'm very happy with the results.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024
content:
This is an interesting presentation of vitamin C serum. I like how the serum is a water like consistency and sinks into skin immediately. There is no burning or tingling upon application. You can layer another serum with more hydrating properties on top of this will no problems at all. I wait 20 minutes before doing so, in order to let the Vitamin C work - I read that you should do that years ago and have always followed that rule, with good results.

This has no scent or fragrance at all, and a little goes a long way. While this says it is a 7 day brightening treatment, there is much more product than you can use in 7 days. The package says this must be used in 30 days, which is typical for a Vitamin C product also, as the effectiveness degrades.

I haven't noticed any results yet, but I am not through with the bottle. I will reevaluate this when it is empty to see if I'll be repurchasing or going back to "my usual" vitamin C.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
content: Brightening serum by Dr Jart+ made in Korea. This is a young skincare brand promoted by teen boy band K Pop. This is a seven day treatment and is in a bottle about 2" in total height. The bottle top contains a teeny round ball that has to be dropped / dissolved in the serum to activate. My ball was crushed so I just got as much as I could in there. I think this is Vitamin C powder. I did think this was a little gimmicky and did not have much hope but I used twice a day for 7 days and have just finished.. The thin yellow serum is used in one very small dropper at a time. I do think it has had a slight effect. My skin was stressed and looking patchy and uneven and I think after 7 days my skin is more even toned. I should have taken a before photo. Dr Jart+ says "expect brilliant results" and brilliant I do not get, but maybe something. I would like to do another 7 days but at $35 it's not really likely.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
content: This is really neat. If you know about vitamin c it is sensative to exposure whether that be from the environment or what it‚Äôs mixed with. It‚Äôs nice to know the vitamin itself hasn‚Äôt been stagnant on a shelf just withering away I some concoction. It‚Äôs also great that the bottle isn‚Äôt clear though I would prefer it to be a darker green or black color but it sits in a closed cabinet so light exposure is minimal. I won‚Äôt really know its effects u til about 90 days. That‚Äôs the thing about skin care is it‚Äôs a waiting game really. This is suppose to be a 30 day supply. So paying 35$ days each time is expensive and not available for everyone especially during this time. I do think they can get the price down for what it is. Pretty much glycerin and vitamin C. I love the consistency? It‚Äôs non greasy it goes on smoothly and sits well under and over other products. You can easily make this last more than 30 days. You only need 1-2 droplets of the serum. If this was about half price I would buy this all the time and I do trust this brand.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
content: This serum is unlike any other I've used. You open the serum, and you open a compartment with a little dissolvable ball in it. You drop the ball into the serum, close it up, and shake it to dissolve the ball. The ball is what contains the vitamin. You are then to use the serum within 30 days. I think it's a really interesting concept, but I don't quite understand it. Why does the vitamin ball have to be held separate from the serum until use? Does that increase its effectiveness? Does that make it work so much better that it's worth only having 30 days with it? These are questions that are not answered.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024
content:
So far so good! I followed the directions on the package of Dr.Jart+ & applied it to my face, which at this age is speckled with a few dark spots that I'm hoping to fade! It was easy to mix & reassemble, & I experienced no stinging or burning sensation. I'm giving it's purchase recommendation with 4 stars only because I need to wait to see how well it really works. After applying be sure to use SPF as instructed. I will update my review at a later time with results!
For now I do recommend the purchase, I'm hoping for a more even skin tone & the reduction of brown spots. I like that it's for sensitive skin & is made with vitamin C & niacinamide to help protect & brighten my skin!

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024
content:
This is a vitamin C serum that comes in a sealed bag, inside which it is boxed. The product needs to be assembled in that you need to remove the cushion around the vitamin ball, get the ball into the container and shake to mix. I almost lost the vitamin ball in the process so it‚Äôs kind of fussy. The total volume is less than a half ounce.

I really like the product! I have used it exclusively on the age spots on my hair line and in one week, I can see a significant difference. It has lightened some hyperpigmented spots and smoothed the rough textured ones. I did completely use up the product in one week so that‚Äôs a cost factor to consider. But it is more effective than anything else I have tried.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2024
content: This was a fun but odd take on a vitamin C serum. You drop the ball into the serum and shake until fully dissolved, and then use it as a regular serum. I'm not sure what the point is, ir if having it in a ball helps the stability of the vitamin c, but it's fun. It didn't dissolve fully, so there were chunks, but it worked for the most part. It claims to be a 7 day brightening ampuole, but the listing shows results after 1 and 4 weeks, so it's something you can definitely use for longer than 7 days. Some people have had an issue with it oxidizing, but I keep it in the fridge and it's been fine for over a month now without turning dark yellow. You don't get a full ounce like you would woth other serums, but it's lasted me for a bit using it once a day. It works about as well as any other vitamin c and niacinamide serums, it isn't greasy and is easy to use without leaving my face feeling too sticky.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
content: Although it works somewhat, it leaves a very sticky residue on my face and I'm not a fan.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024
content: The purpose of this product is to serve as a power treatment over 7 days. One need to ‚Äúactivate‚Äù the vitamin C ball by dropping it into the serum, so the vitamin C doesn‚Äôt degrade while the product sit on the shelf (generally vitamin C products are recommended to be used up within a few months or stored in an opaque bottle away from sunlight to minimize oxidation). If one is to use up the product within 7 days, technically the vitamin C would be at its peak potency. Following the logic, this is a really expensive skincare product if one is to purchase four of this every month. I mean, yes, the serum has been very moisturizing and firming on the face, but that‚Äôs quite an effort to restock this product so frequently and at this price tag, when there are many other products out there. This product is for people who want super high quality and fresh vitamin C, and this does deliver itself as a high quality product.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
content:
I thought the idea of the serum was pretty cool. It was "activated" when you mixed the ingredients together. Easy to do but once mixed, the bottle only seemed 1/2 full. You do not need a lot as a small amount goes a long way but for the price, I would think you would get a little more product. I was also surprised the product has a pretty short shelf life once activated.
I do think the serum is nice and my skin looks nice after using. I just don't think I would order again based on the price, amount and shelf life.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
content: I saw a little improvement on my age spots on my face but not by much. It does leave my skin feeling a little tacky after it dries down. It didn‚Äôt aggravate my rosacea skin. No added fragrance is a big positive! I have noticed that the serum gets darker with age. When I first mixed the Vit C bead with the liquid solution, the end product was an amber color. A few weeks later, it‚Äôs now brown. Lastly, the bottle and dropper are both made of glass. I think it‚Äôs a positive so the vitamin c doesn‚Äôt react to plastic however, take care as glass can break.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024
content: Nice serum. Nice consistency. It didn‚Äôt come with clear instructions but if I can figure it out so can you

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin Brightening Serum For Visible Fine Lines with Vitamin C and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.27 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
content: The Dr. Jart brightening serum comes in a very light weight sealed foil pack. Inside there is a small bottle which is used to mix fresh vitamin C serum. The design is to ensure the freshness of the serum since the serum is only mixed before use. My face does feel soft, smoother and less textured when using this. But the quantity included only lasted a week for me when used on the whole face, my skin went back to its norm when the product ran out. I think the price seem high since it's hard to see results in such as short time. If not regarding the cost, then the product seems to have high quality ingredient and great design.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
content: Wow is all I could say not too thick not too thin. I‚Äôm already signed to see a difference bay3

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2024
content: I've been using this for around 3 weeks now, my skin feels smoother, I have way less redness on my cheeks. The smell isnt too bad. Overall I am happy with this purchase.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
content:
I like that this has an assortment of products to try. But, tbh, the color correcting SPF was why I ordered it. To see other people's reviews, it looks like it works like magic.

Unfortunately, I found yet again, you can't believe everything you see on the Internet.

I am on a constant search for a good moisturizer/SPF bc I use it daily and it's kind of my obsession.

If I didn't know anything about this product, I would give it low rating and toss it. But I will keep using it in case it's just user error on my part... although I really can't figure out how to use this in a way that works for my skin type.

I have medium olive skin. This goes on with an obvious white cast that disperses a bit but still makes me look a shade paler than I am. I don't know how it will look on even darker skin tones. I have dry areas but routinely moisturize so I didn't habe any actively flaky areas when I tried this. The green cream goes on and feels a little tacky and it's a little difficult to rub in. I was worried it wouldn't "melt" into my skin so much as settle on top of it - and that's totally what this does. Especially around my nose - I just see product awkwardly apparent...looking a bit dry.

I think I will need to figure out how to mix this into some sort of moisturizer to help it blend and settle better. Very disappointing given the price point and hype.

I still think it may be worth trying - maybe it will work better for you and your skin type. But I truly haven't found a "color correcting" or "foundation replacing" SPF moisturizer that isn't problematic.

I'll post a pic but it's so hard to photograph. Just be aware that if you're out and about, it will be obvious that you have product on your face bc this settles in dry areas or nooks (esp around nose) and give you an extra dusty/dry/flaky look. Iykyk.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024
content: I‚Äôd been wanting to try Dr Jart cicapair for a while but was concerned my skin wouldn‚Äôt love it. This travel size set is perfect t for an introduction to these products. Turns out my skin loves them, they have helped a lot with redness in the cheeks. Now I have to buy the bigger sizes, they‚Äôre amazing!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
content: Although this kit is a travel set, I feel it's more of a sample kit. The cleanser cleans well, the repair cream and the serum mask are more hydrating to the skin, and the color-correcting treatment helps reduce the redness on my skin. It is not worth the price to me.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
content: Nice trial size set of products. Helped reduce the appearance of redness on my skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2024
content: I personally didn't like the color corrector as I feel like it pulled really really orange on my cool toned skin. for some people, this isn't an issue. All of the products in this trial kit were really gentle and soothing. I have combination skin that leans to the drier side. My skin really likes Cica and my skin looked pretty good while using these. I really like these trial size kids. I think the amount of products included in these is enough to decide if the product is something you like and something that works with your skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
content:
I am in love with everything included in this travel set! I have combo skin, sensitive, rosacea, and am pale. If you'd like to see the ingredients lists for each product, they're in my photos. For most of the products, niacinamide is decently low on the ingredient list, just fyi. I haven't experienced any irritation so far.

The tiger grass color correcting cream has a lovely finish. I can get away with not wearing foundation over it, but it evens my skin out so well that I definitely have to add some color back in. If you want to wear it on its own, any shine can easily be toned down with setting powder or spray if needed. It still looks great at the end of the day, really long lasting. A little goes a long way, so this jar should last awhile. It blends really easily, too. Does pair well with my other makeup.

The Cicapair foaming cleanser is super gentle and doesn't leave my skin feeling stripped of moisture (it contains glycerin!) I feel like it does a pretty good job of removing residue, but I do use a gentle micellar water first to make sure my sunscreen and stuff dissolves before I actually wash with a cleanser.

One of my favorites so far is the Cicapair intensive soothing repair cream. It's a thicker, waxy/silky type cream, but it doesn't take a ton to cover your face. It's green coming out of the tube, but there's no color once applied to skin. It has so many high quality ingredients to help repair skin's barrier, soothe, and lock in mousture. I personally wouldn't think this would wear well under makeup; I think it's more for PM routine use. It is incredibly nourishing and really helps my skin a lot.

Lastly, the intensive soothing repair serum mask feels amazing. It's a cellulose sheet mask with a gel like fabric, packed with serum. I wore it for about 20 minutes and massaged in any remaining serum. It's incredibly hydrating, cooling, and soothing. It contains a lot of the same ingredients as the aforementioned cream.

If you'd like to dip your toes into the Dr. Jart+ Cicapair line, I'd highly recommend giving this kit a try to see if your skin agrees with the commonly used ingredients between the products. As someone with sensitive/reactive skin and rosacea, I'm really thrilled that I can actually use all the products.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024
content:
Because these products full size can be pretty expensive, this is a decent way to try out these products on a smaller scale. I didn't really like using any of these, unfortunately, so none of them were that great, in my opinion.

Cleanser: This is a decent, semi-moisturizing cleanser. I find it's not strong enough to remove sunscreen and make-up, but it also doesn't strip my skin of moisture. I liked this ok, but it's not as good as other cleansers I've used that are lot less expensive.

Mask: It's a standard sheet mask. I found it felt a tiny bit stingy at first, but I got used to it quickly. It moisturized my skin just fine, but wasn't anything special.

Barrier repair moisturizer: This is a thick moisturizer with a lot of glycerin. You really need a serum or toner on under it, to hydrate. This does a good job sealing in moisture, like a top coat. It has a mild grassy smell.

Color correcting spf: This cream is thick and a bit hard to blend. It starts out a greenish-white color, then oxidizes to be more skin colored. I find it's too dark and a warm for my skin tone. It probably would work best for someone with light to medium warm skin tones. You have to use a lot to make the SPF effective, which causes it to feel pretty heavy. I didn't like this and only used it once.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
content: This is a wonderful travel skincare set. Dr. Jart, a recognized brand name in Korean skincare. I like the variety of the items in here. For people with sensitive skin like me, I really like this. It is a little bit more substantial than a trial set. It really is the whole routine, from cleansing to pampering, it feels like it could be a great part of a vacation. I think that the color-correcting cream with SPF is interesting, I haven't used many of these before - just standalone spf. It is rated at 30SPF though, which I would say is more on the minimal side. I would've liked to see 50, but I don't think it is a huge deal. Of course, when you see the shade of this cream online, you could instantly tell whether or not that shade works for your skin tone.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
content:
The Cicapair Redness Rescue Travel Size Value Kit is specifically designed for individuals with redness-prone skin, making it the perfect solution for those with sensitive skin like mine. The kit includes a full skincare regimen in travel-friendly sizes, making it convenient to take on-the-go or use as a trial before committing to the full-size products.
Cicapair Tiger Grass Color Correcting Treatment, which is a green-to-beige color-correcting cream that helps to neutralize redness and even out skin tone. I was impressed by how lightweight and breathable the formula felt on my skin, and how it effectively covered up any redness without looking cakey or feeling heavy.

The kit also includes a Foaming Cleanser, Treatment Toner, Serum, and Cream, all of which are formulated with soothing ingredients like Centella Asiatica, Tiger Grass, and Houttuynia Cordata to calm and restore irritated skin. I noticed a significant improvement in the overall appearance of my skin after incorporating these products into my daily skincare routine. My skin felt more hydrated, balanced, and less red and irritated.
Overall, I highly recommend the Dr.Jart Cicapair Redness Rescue Travel Size Value Kit.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
content:
This would be a valuable starter kit to introduce new buyers to Dr Jart products if it had more of the Cicapair products that are universal for everyone. As it stands, this kit contains a very tiny sample size squeeze tube of Cicapair moisturizer and an equally small container of Cicapair cleansing foam. But there‚Äôs a large jar of the color-correcting Cicapair rescue balm. The color changes from green to beige. My skin is brown, so walking about with beige-tinted skin isn‚Äôt very helpful for me. I would‚Äôve preferred to have more moisturizer and cleanser instead.

The Cicapair moisturizer works great at providing a skin protective barrier. I use it as the last step in my skin care routine. It helps reduce redness and inflammation and is great for sensitive skin. I don‚Äôt use this as my only moisturizer though because, while think that Dr, Jart products are more for locking in moisture, they don‚Äôt provide enough skin hydration on their own.

The Cicapair foaming cleanser is a wonderful, gentle skin cleanser that leaves my face feeling refreshed. It foams easily and rinses clean.

This kit isn‚Äôt a great value. In fact it‚Äôs extremely expensive. These products are customer sample size and Dr Jart should feel ashamed for selling these at such exorbitant costs. Still, the products work well. I think it‚Äôs probably better to search out discounts and buy directly from the Dr Jart website.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
content: Amazing

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content:
This is a travel sized skincare kit where the products aren't actually that small. You get a substantial amount of products , some of them are my favorites from Dr Jart.
The cleanser is one of the best on the market IMO. It's one of those foaming cleaners that are very effective in removing caked on sunscreen, while it does not dry the skin out at all. In fact, it feels as if I already moisturized my face after washing. I love this cleanser, I have a giant container of it in my skincare stash.
Another product I adore is the green SPF containing redness reliever. It's a thick dense cream. A tiny drop needs to be rubbed into the skin, and it completely blocks all redness on my skin. The cream looks green but it blends into the skin and turns my skin color but without the red tone. Less is more here. Don't rely on this product for SPF alone! Use a sunscreen underneath, then dab this green cream on top then might use foundation if you wear it, or nothing else. Your skin will look radiant but not irritated anymore. Dr Jart has this green tinted product in a dropper form in this line and I love that too.
Then there's a moisturizer, that feels nice and nourishing but not overly greasy, so it could be worn day or night.
And finally there's a full size sheet mask to pamper yourself. The sheet mask has a ton of serum, I ended up rubbing it all over my neck, chest, arms and belly. Or you can save the pouch and use the remaining serum the next day. It feels cooling and very moisturizing.
I highly recommend this skincare kit from Dr Jart.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
content:
This value kit is great all around, but WOW is the Derma Green Solution absolutely incredible!!!!

I love this travel size kit because I'm able to try the variety of Dr. Jart+ products that I've been wanting to sample, without the commitment of purchasing full size versions of each.

I have always had redness in my T-zone and regardless of what skincare products I have tried in the past, nothing as worked as well as the Derma Green Solution in this set! I was blown away by the difference in my skin tone upon the very 1st application and it instantly became my daily go-to product - my entire complexion completely transformed, and my skintone finally looks even!!! I am in my mid 40s and after wearing heavy makeup to camouflage my redness for the majority of my life, I have been to a point over the last year or so where I much prefer to wear a good moisturizer and sunscreen versus foundation, but I never could bring myself to feel entirely confident without foundation until now! The other products in this set are great, too (the soothing cream is my 2nd favorite!!) and I haven't experienced any sensitivity or reaction upon using them daily.

Definitely give this value set a try if you've been interested in exploring Dr. Jart+ products, and especially if you've been searching for high quality products that will help minimize facial redness -- you will absolutely love these products!!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
content: Does not break me out. The material is thin and feel comfortable on the skin. There is a light scent but it does not bother me. It‚Äôs great for traveling

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask

I‚Äôve always had red and sensitive skin, and these are truly a lifesaver! A little goes a long way, but it works so well. I‚Äôn so astonished as most products I‚Äôve used for redness just rub off. I use it just in my t zone so that I don‚Äôt lose all my color. The cleanser isn‚Äôt overly stripping, and the serum masks makes my skin feel so smooth and plump. The whole kit is perfect for a night time regimen!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask

I often have red undertones to my skin so I was especially interested in these products with cica in them. title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask

content: Great on my sensitive skin and excellent size for travel! Really helped reduce redness on certain areas of my face like around my nose and eyes. Love this product line!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024
content: I have a touch of rosacea on my cheeks and this didn't do much for it. I'm glad it was just a trial size. Didn't seem to quiet it down at all, although I followed instructinons.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
content:
Always I was curious to try the color correcting cream from Dr. Jart, but it's so expensive that didn't want to splurge in case it didn't work for me or my teen. I was super excited to see that this is the whole set I can try, before deciding to buy full size products.

Box comes packaged nicely, with a plastic seal you have to break to get inside. There's a clear expiration date like on all respectable Korean products. You get four items, enough for you to decide if it's going to work for your skin. This is supposed to work for red or irritated skin, but I got it for my teen who struggles with acne, and does have some red spots here and there. I get some redness too occasionally, so testing this one out as well.

We both are satisfied so far, but I will definitely update my review if our opinion drastucalky changes once were done with the sample sizes.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2024
content: after one use, seeing improvement! the mask is great, the spf color correcter, face wash and moisturizer. sizes vary for uses. would buy again!

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
content:
I struggle with chronic skin redness, especially in my T-zone. It's frustrating and embarrassing, and a lot of times makeup does not do as good of a job as it should. This kit made me feel like I'm tackling the redness from all angles, and it has made my skin look better than it has in years.
The cleanser feels great and is super gentle. I like the moisturizer as well, but my favorite is the color correcting cream (light green). I was actually shocked at the difference. My mom, who has rosacea, also tried this when I told her about it and she was blown away with its effectiveness.
I'll be buying full-size products of these.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2025
content:
When I bought this product, I thought it'd be a slam dunk, especially since redness is my biggest frustration and I am a fan of Dr Jart's. Plus, it was a premium price tag, so must be a premium product, right? Well, not always...
The gel cleanser only works ok, and REALLY stings if you get it in your eyes.
The moisturizer is also ok, but I seem to need much more of it than other moisturizers to achieve the same results, and it's a tiny, expensive tube so that's kind of a bummer.
And the Tiger Balm, the #1 most touted product, in my opinion, is too heavy and dry, and definitely doesn't leave a natural looking finish, BUT it does fully cover redness. So it's good under a tinted moisturizer + bronzer (I've been avoiding blush to also help minimize the look of redness and find bronzer to work very well on its own), but definitely not a product for "no makeup" days. And honestly, I like my Cover Girl color correcting primer much better, and it's a fraction of the price.
Only REALLY good thing about this tester pack is that I got to try each product without having to fork over the full price of each full sized product. So if you're dealing with redness, I say THIS pack IS the way to try these products, and who knows, maybe they'll work much better for you. They just aren't my favorite, though I do intend to investigate more cira products from other brands.
Note: I have fair, combination skin with light freckles, especially in the summer. And in my opinion, this product would work best for those with oily skin. I would not recommend it at all for those with dry skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Korean Skin Care Set, Travel Size Value Gift Set with Cicapair Color Correcting Cream, Face Wash, Cream Moisturizer, and Face Mask
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content:
The "Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Redness Rescue Travel Size Value Kit, Suitable for Sensitive Skin" kit is a great introduction to the Dr. Jart line - a well known Korean brand for sensitive skin!

Summary - great if you have sensitive, reactive, eczema/rosacea skin, well known brand with cica aka. 'tiger grass' a superstar in sensitive skincare, quality sealed products that will last a long time!

I am the perfect person to test this - I have adult acne, and although my skin never used to be sensitive, it was always red and in the past year, has become reactive to a lot of things - I had a big allergic reaction a week ago and my skin is left dry/oily/texturized/and red. In my photo I show my skin before- mostly healed but still sensitive. Then after the wash -

Everything is sealed with a little tab to pull off, so it's fresh!
The wash - foams nicely, almost no scent but a sliiiiiight metallic tone if I had to pick? Felt nice, removed my thick nightly lotion from the night before and didn't feel tight afterward.
The cream - a slight green hue but goes on invisibly. I thought I felt a slight tingle but it could just be my skin is so sensitive, even gently applying cream tingles. It didn't sting and it dried invisible, not greasy, not overly matte. Felt nice. Put it in my elbow crease too and no reactions there.
The color correcting cream - I already have a full size of this and it is literally over a year old and I"m not even half way though- so this size I would actually prefer to keep it fresh! and it is great depending on your skin. It's a mineral sunscreen so there is an obvious white cast depending on how much you apply. I took this to Japan in the spring when it was cooler than Im' used to, and my dried out skin did show horrible flakes and dryness, although the cream felt really nice. If I apply this thick, it's almost like full coverage foundation, and it will stay 'dewy' if that's your thing - but I find it transfers and feels sticky unless I set it with powder, which does emphasize dry flakes. HOWEVER if you use just a bit, like sunscreen, it fades into my skin invisibly with just a hint of coverage over my red patches. Just depends on how red you are, and how much coverage you want. It has never broken me out.

Overall, the sizes of these items are a bit more than say a free trial size, this would be perfect for a vacation of 2 weeks - a month in my opinion. If you have sensitive skin, you may have heard about the start ingredient here 'tiger grass' aka Cica which is all the rage in sensitive skincare. I highly recommend this kit if you're curious about Dr. Jart and if you have redness especially rosacea or eczema like me. I wish the cost was cheaper, but honestly this set will late you quite a long time!
