title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Intensive Soothing Repair Treatment Liquid Face Lotion to Reduce Redness | Hydrating Toner | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
content:
The texture of this product is pretty unique. It looks like water but when I apply it to my face it feels more slippery. I have sensitive skin and can‚Äôt wear products that will weigh me down and I didn‚Äôt have any negative reactions to it. Also, a great plus point, it doesn't have a scent and no fragrance in the ingredient list. Under my daily face oil it doesn‚Äôt feel heavy or anything. I don't generally have redness on my skin but I do think it could be beneficial to soothing the skin.

Based on the ingredient list this seems like a super hyaluronic acid serum (an ingredient list which I do not appreciate is not presented on the product page. I included a picture of it). It's got a few extra ingredients that help with balancing and absorption and skin repair. However, I am not entirely convinced of its value. I could go with a good hyaluronic acid serum (with arguably cleaner simpler ingredients) for quite a bit less. Yes, I know, there is a difference between sodium hyaluronate and hyaluronic acid. And, yes, one could argue that sodium hyaluronate has its benefits over hyaluronic acid. Not to mention the other active ingredients this has. Plus, a little goes a long way with this product. I just don‚Äôt see as big of a difference as I would have thought.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Ectoin-Infused Face Cream Moisturizer for Dry Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content: This cream is a must have for everyone who uses retinol, especially prescription tretinoin, and chemical peels, like me. I peel my skin almost every week because this is how tretinoin works, so it makes my skin irritated and sensitive. This cream from Dr Jart is a must have repair tool. It's a very thick balm-like cream that's deeply nourishing and cushioning. I highly recommend using the toner that comes in this skincare line -rectangular white bottle with a yellow top. Dr Jart has many different skincare lines, but stick with the repair line if your skin is sensitive and has a poor barrier. I apply the repair toner first then this cream. The cream is so thick like a lip balm, you'll need to use a spatula that comes in the box. The cream warms up on my skin and rubs in easily. It's not greasy, but it's extremely nourishing. Literally the next morning all redness on my cheeks that I get after peel is completely gone and my skin has it's natural barrier back. This cream is better used for nighttime treatments, it might be too heavy for daytime. It's very moisturizing, nourishing and skin softening. No scent noted, which is a huge plus too. Highly recommend this product for anyone with dry, aging, sensitive or irritated skin.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content:
The Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer is a standout product for those with sensitive skin prone to redness. This gel-based moisturizer is designed to soothe irritation and provide a cooling sensation, which can be particularly refreshing in hot weather or after a long day.

Key ingredients include Centella Asiatica (also known as Cica or Tiger Grass), known for its healing and anti-inflammatory properties. This makes the moisturizer especially beneficial for calming red, irritated skin. The lightweight, gel texture absorbs quickly without leaving a sticky residue, making it suitable for layering under makeup or using as a soothing treatment before bed.

One of the most appreciated aspects of this moisturizer is its ability to deliver hydration without feeling heavy or clogging pores, making it a good option for combination and oily skin types. The cooling effect is mild but noticeable, offering a pleasant, refreshing feel upon application.

The product is fragrance-free, which is a plus for those with sensitive skin who often find fragranced products irritating. The packaging is also convenient, with a hygienic pump dispenser that ensures you use the right amount without contamination.

Overall, Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer is an excellent choice for anyone dealing with redness, irritation, or sensitivity. It provides effective hydration, soothes the skin, and leaves it feeling cool and refreshed. While it may be on the pricier side, the quality and results make it a worthwhile investment for those with sensitive skin concerns.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
content: I have bunch of Dr. Jart products, and they are consistently great. This Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer is another amazing product. The gel texture is very cooling and soothing, but unlike some gel products, it isn't too sticky or stiff-feeling as it dries. It soaks into the skin very nicely and provides a gentle moisture that hydrates without feeling oily or heavy. It wears well by itself, but also works great as a base layer under sunscreen and makeup. I also use the Dr. Jart Tiger Grass Color Correcting face cream, and it pairs very well with this moisturizer if you're somebody that likes to combine different products from the same line as part of your face routine.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
content:
Having mature combination skin, I'm all over the skincare map. Some days my goal is to go full out on the moisturization to please the more mature side of my complexion. Other days I need to concentrate on sopping up oils and treating problematic concerns. Of course, those are the extremes. Mostly I'm good adding a little moisturization, as well as making sure my pores are nice and clear. This moisturizing gel cream is ideal for me. It adds a little bit of moisturization while also making sure that any problematic issues are kept under control. It's cool and soothing and absorbs well. Very clean and safer for those who need a gentler moisturizer. Lightweight and protective. Sometimes I use this over all of my face, while other times I'll use it for spot work on my nose and other oilier parts. This is a safe one for my concerns.

An excellent moisturize cream for those looking for a lightweight and extra clean moisturizer that will help ease problematic areas without causing issues. Especially good for combination skin. It's soothing and helpful. Great for those on the oilier side of the ph spectrum. Just as good for men as it is for women. Good for al adult age groups, from teens to seniors.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
content: Dr. Jart's Cica line is amazing for those who deal with facial redness. I've been using this line for years and am always excited when something new is added to the lineup. Unlike the plain moisturizer, this gel cream is lightweight, cooling, and quick absorbing. The cica moisturizer (in the tube) is better for cooler/colder weather and provides some extra oomph for dry skin. And unlike the color correcting moisturizer, this one doesn't really do much to hide or coverup the redness. The light green tint to this gel offers almost zero redness correction. It's more of a skin calming product that helps alleviate the underlying cause of the redness, like rosacea, sun exposure, chapped skin, etc. It is fantastic at helping to calm skin down if you've gone a little gung-ho with exfoliation or masks. This is one of those skincare products you want to keep in the fridge as it feels absolutely amazing on irritated skin. For those with really dry skin, this might not be enough moisturizer on its own. When paired with something like HA serum, as long as you wait for the serum to fully absorb before applying this gel moisturizer it won't pill up while applying. It's also lightweight enough that you can use a heavier moisturizer over the top, especially at night. Does well under makeup primers as long as you give it time to absorb so that your skin is dry before applying the primer. Aside from helping calm skin and providing moisture, this gel isn't an anti-aging product. But with its skin calming properties, it does pair very well with products with retinol or retinoids which can cause redness, drying, and flaking. The Dr. Jart Cica line is one of the two redness lines (the other is La Roche Posey) that actually works with my rosacea and makes a visible difference.

title: Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer for Redness and Sensitive Skin | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024
content:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I was thrilled to try the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel Face Moisturizer, specifically designed to address redness and sensitive skin concerns. This Korean skincare brand has crafted a unique gel-based moisturizer that delivers a calming and refreshing sensation to irritated complexions. Here's an honest review of my experience:

Soothing and Calming:
One of the standout features of this moisturizer is its ability to instantly soothe and calm irritated skin. Infused with centella asiatica and aloe vera, this gel provides a cooling sensation that helps reduce redness and inflammation. My skin felt comforted and relieved, especially during periods of sensitivity and reactivity.

Lightweight and Quick-Absorbing:
The gel-based formula is incredibly lightweight and has a refreshing texture. It absorbs quickly into the skin, providing an immediate cooling effect without leaving any greasy or sticky residue. My skin felt hydrated and balanced, with no heavy or oily sensation often associated with traditional creams.

Redness Reduction:
The formula is designed to target redness and inflamed skin, a common concern for sensitive skin types. The combination of centella asiatica and aloe vera works synergistically to alleviate redness, providing a more even and calm complexion. Over time, I noticed a visible improvement in the overall appearance of my skin's redness.

Suitable for Sensitive Skin:
As a K-beauty enthusiast with sensitive skin, I appreciate that this moisturizer is carefully formulated to be gentle and non-irritating. Free from potential irritants like parabens and fragrances, it ensures a safe and soothing experience for even the most delicate complexions.

Overall Complexion Enhancement:
Not only does this moisturizer address redness, but it also enhances the overall appearance of the skin. My skin looked healthier and more radiant, with a noticeable improvement in texture and tone. It provided a beautiful canvas for makeup application, creating a smooth and even base.

Overall Recommendation:
As a K-beauty enthusiast, I highly recommend the Dr.Jart+ Cicapair Cooling Gel to anyone seeking a soothing and refreshing solution for sensitive and irritated skin. The gel-based formula delivers instant calming relief, reduces redness, and enhances the overall complexion. It's a must-have in your skincare arsenal if you're looking for a gentle and effective moisturizer.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin‚Ñ¢ Skin Barrier Moisturizing Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
content: I think there is a common misconception that face masks are supposed to be a cure-all or show remarkably different skin after one use. Face masks need to be used as an enhancement with your regular skin care line and can be used weekly, or even daily, depending on what your needs are. Face masks are designed to offer more product on your face for a longer period of time so you can get it deeper into your skin. Your skin cells turn over one every 28 days or so, so in reality you need to try something for 28 days before you can see a difference. That being said, I was very happy with how noticeably shinier and moisturized my skin looked after this! It is a bit expensive, but the ceramidin is a great ingredient that gets deep moisture into your skin. I recommend it, and will be buying it again!

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin‚Ñ¢ Skin Barrier Moisturizing Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
content: This Ceramidin Skin Barrier Moisturizing Face Mask was such a treat for my dry, sensitive, and red skin! It helped to give my skin an extra boost in moisture. I like to use this mask on days when my skin feels extra dry. Because this mask has ceramides and panthenol, and I know my skin responds really well to these ingredients, it worked really well for my purposes. These moisturizing properties in face masks are a bit harder to find as the market is saturated with hyaluronic acid. I am glad that Dr. Jart still aims to provide the best skin care ingredients to its customers.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin‚Ñ¢ Skin Barrier Moisturizing Face Mask | Sheet Mask | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content:
I always love to try new beauty products, but do limit myself to clean products. Since there are no ingredients listed here, this was a long shot but I was glad to receive the product and not see any ingredient that was particularly alarming (don't need the Yellow N5, tho!).

I do find it suspicious when brands do not list their ingredients and wish they would do so for all of their products. It's like, what are you trying to hide? So I've included a picture of the ingredient list.

The mask does have a floral scent, which is from geranium oil, but I did not find it overpowering and I am allergic to fragrance.

It is pretty goopy and the the mask is a bit tricky to unpack. My face may be on the small side but I still felt like some areas weren't covered with this and it didn't fit on great over the eyes. I know you can rip it apart on the nose but I always hate to do that because I like to get as much coverage as possible!

Someone said there was enough in there to apply it a second day. I definitely didn't feel there was enough in the pouch to coat the mask a second time but there was definitely extra cream that can be scooped out and applied elsewhere (or I guess saved for another day but it would likely dry out).

It was moisturizing, though, and was a nice treat for my face. At this price point, it isn't something I would do regularly.

content:
I didn't even know Dr. Jart made a hand cream so I was THRILLED to give it a try when I saw it.

I will say that I'm not a fan of most hand creams. In fact, my go to isn't a dedicated hand cream at all. I have a few requirements when it comes to hand creams: non-greasy, quick absorbing, and actually works on dry (potentially scaly) skin. This Dr. Jart does all of that. Initially I thought that the price point was a bit high for a hand cream. However, there is a LOT of product in the tube. It's about the size of a normal size of toothpaste and dispenses similarly. While the tube is large, it still is slim enough to easily tuck into a bag or a purse. I do wish it had a flip cap instead but really not a big deal.

I think I found a new favorite and definitely see myself repurchasing when I run out. GREAT stuff

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Body Lotion Moisturizer for Dry Skin with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 6.76 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
content:
Dr Jart+ has been around for ages! One of the OG Korean brands. This moisturizer is very light. great for summer or someone who doesn't like using lotion. It's fragrance free and light. I barely feel it on my skin. I'm use to more thick lotions. I like how this doesn't leave a greasy film over the hands. Especially when I'm trying to use my phone or laptop, creams tend to smug all over the screen.

I think if you routinely use lotion, this product would seem lackluster - but I like using it while on the go. I like the ceramides it has and I love the packaging. I was surprised how much bigger the bottle was in person compared to the photo.

If it came down to it, I think this product is a nice to have, but not super essential. It would make a great gift for those who are just starting out with skincare or those who have sensitive skin. It does what it says it does but I feel like I could easily mistaken this for "hotel lotion" (consistency wise) or something from the dollar store. Still makes a great splurge if you want to treat yourself.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Under Eye Cream with Ceramides and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.5 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
content:
The **Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Under Eye Cream** is a well-formulated product aimed at addressing dryness, fine lines, and puffiness around the delicate under-eye area. Here‚Äôs a detailed review based on its features, performance, and overall value.

**Packaging & Presentation:**
The eye cream comes in a sleek, easy-to-use tube that allows for precise application. The packaging is hygienic and travel-friendly, which is a plus for those who need an on-the-go skincare solution. The design is simple yet effective, with a minimalistic aesthetic that reflects the brand‚Äôs clinical approach.

**Formula & Ingredients:**
The cream is powered by Dr.Jart+‚Äôs signature Ceramidin Complex, which is rich in ceramides‚Äîa crucial component for maintaining the skin‚Äôs moisture barrier. This formula is designed to deeply hydrate the skin, helping to strengthen and repair the delicate under-eye area. The cream also includes hyaluronic acid, which provides an extra boost of hydration, and niacinamide, known for its brightening and anti-inflammatory properties.

**Application & Texture:**
The texture of the Ceramidin Under Eye Cream is lightweight and smooth, making it easy to apply without dragging the sensitive skin around the eyes. It absorbs quickly, leaving the skin feeling soft and hydrated without any greasy residue. The cream feels soothing upon application and works well under makeup, making it a versatile addition to both morning and evening skincare routines.

**Performance:**
With consistent use, many users notice a reduction in dryness and an improvement in the overall texture of the under-eye area. The cream effectively hydrates, reducing the appearance of fine lines caused by dehydration. While it provides a good level of moisture, the results in terms of dark circles or puffiness might not be as pronounced as some might hope, especially if these issues are more severe or caused by factors other than dryness.

**Pros:**
- **Deeply hydrating:** Rich in ceramides and hyaluronic acid, it effectively moisturizes the under-eye area.
- **Lightweight texture:** Absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy residue.
- **Soothing formula:** Feels calming and comfortable on the skin.
- **Good under makeup:** Works well as a base for concealer or other eye makeup.
- **Packaging:** Hygienic and convenient for travel.

**Cons:**
- **Limited results on dark circles and puffiness:** While it hydrates well, it may not significantly reduce more pronounced dark circles or puffiness.
- **Price:** On the higher end, which may be a consideration for those on a budget.
- **Subtle results:** For those looking for dramatic improvements in the under-eye area, this might not be the most potent option.

**Verdict:**
The **Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Under Eye Cream** is a solid choice for those seeking a deeply hydrating and soothing eye cream. It excels in moisturizing and strengthening the delicate skin around the eyes, making it a great option for addressing dryness and fine lines caused by dehydration. However, if you‚Äôre looking for a product that targets dark circles or puffiness more aggressively, you might need to pair it with other treatments or look for a more specialized product. Overall, it's a reliable, high-quality eye cream, particularly for those focused on hydration and maintaining the skin's barrier function.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin Under Eye Cream with Ceramides and Niacinamide | Korean Skin Care, 0.5 Fl Oz

content:

The first thing I noticed about this cream is the scent, which is not aloe as described on the listing. No, it's way better than that! I just love how this cream smells, it's a spicy herbal scent that smells vaguely medicinal. To me, the smell alone makes me feel like I'm at a spa.

There is nothing not to like about this eye cream. The list of ingredients reads like a encyclopedia of ingredients that are good for your skin- ceramides, niacinamide, betaine, squalane, mannitol, Allantoin, adenosine, plus a host of plant oils and extracts.

I love putting this cream on, it's thick and silky, and you only need a little. In the mornings I always wake up with puffy eyes but since I started using this cream, not so much anymore. Of course I haven't noticed much else different, but given the host of lovely ingredients in this cream I expect other benefits to become noticeable over time.

At time of this review, this eye cream is selling for $40. Considering how packed full it is of great ingredients, I'm going to say it's definitely worth it.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content: I ordered the Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator, 5.07 fl oz. I've been doing professional grade peels at home for many years and I'm quite seasoned in it. I use all different types of acids of different percentages and focus on different areas including other spots on my body. Anytime I am using these types of products. I am militant about sunscreen since the protective layer on my face is usually removed when I'm doing these products, so it's crucial to stay out of the sun or use strong protection so I don't damage my skin. I learned this the hard way many years ago not knowing what could happen, which I ended up getting tons of sunspots because I was foolish. Anyway, products like this tend to dry my face out so I just intuitively use it and really bump up my moisturizer while it does its thing. I could use this everyday since my skin is so used to this, but I am just going to use it a couple times a week. I've done exfoliating treatments with it and just have used a cotton ball with it. It's a thicker consistency and goes on like a thickened toner. My skin definitely feels cleaner and more refreshed. Anytime I use these types of products it takes my skin 30 days to fully turn over for me to really see the difference even though I may notice immediately. That's when people usually start asking what I've been doing with my face after the 30-day mark. Overall, I'm happy with this and will keep using it, thank you.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
content:
I'm very pleased with this 'Dr.Jart+' Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator. It's a gentle sort of peel that has smoothness; takes away the dullness of my skin when I want a resurfacing or renewed glow to my face.‚ú®Ô∏è
I use a little on a cotton swab/pad, and glide it over my face-making sure my skin is gently cleansed first. I've noticed that just within a few days I've noticed a difference in the appearance (and feel) of my skin. I really like how this works, and didn't cause me any irritation or anything.
There is a light scent (in my opinion), but I don't think it's overpowering. Some people with scent sensitivity may have an issue (and I do have some scent sensitivity); however, I did not experience any issues from this. Everyone is different; though, I find this to be both effective and gentle.‚ù§Ô∏è
I really like this brand, as this is not the first item I've used by Dr.Jart+; and I really like how nice of quality this product is.. I prefer this product (over the other similar products I've tried over the years), and would definitely reorder. title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2024
content: I‚Äôve been using Dr. Jart‚Äôs Pore Remedy for a while. Not only does it make my skin softer, but it‚Äôs also gentle, There is no burning or irritation. I incorporate it once a week after washing my face, right before my moisturizing routine. As part of my skin cycling regimen, I exfoliate with this product at night, follow up with a retinol product the next day, and then rest my skin, focusing solely on moisturizers. title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz

I know some people can have irritation from fragrances so this could cause a problem for them. I did not experience any issues or irritation.

title: Dr.Jart+ Pore.Remedy 5% Multi-Acid Radiance Peel Face Exfoliator For Face | Korean Skin Care, 5.07 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2024
content:
As someone with stubborn pores and occasional dullness, I'm always interested in trying new exfoliators. This pore remedy comes with its promise of brighter, smoother skin thanks to a multi-acid complex was very intriguing.

The packaging is sleek and the product itself is a clear liquid with a very faint scent. It comes with a handy pump dispenser, which makes it easy to dispense a controlled amount onto a cotton pad. This isn't a harsh scrub by any means. It has a gentle tingling sensation that lets you know it's working, but it's not irritating at all. The key with this product is consistency. It took about three weeks for me to really notice a difference in my skin texture and overall radiance. My pores appear a bit more refined, and my skin definitely looks brighter and smoother.

I recommend doing a patch test first, especially if you have sensitive skin. And because it has AHA/BHA acids, make sure to wear sunscreen every day, rain or shine! It's easy to use, not irritating, and delivers noticeable results with consistent use.

title: Dr.Jart+ Premium BB Tinted Moisturizer with SPF 40 and Niacinamide | bb cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
content:
I've never used a BB cream before, but have heard a lot about them. I decided to order this because of the built-in sunscreen. I ordered the light to medium shade, which I was hoping would work because usually medium is too dark for me and light is way too light for me. This shade covers well, although I probably wouldn't be able to use it outside of the summertime because it is slightly too dark for my comfort. It doesn't look bad right now because I have the grass cutting tan on my face :-)

You only need a very small amount of this. I use less than a pea size and that covers my whole face and over my chin line. There was a little bit of learning curve for me because I found that if I put this on without a moisturizer it just did not look natural. If I used my regular moisturizer and then this you could see every pore on my face. I used a lightweight face serum, let it soak into my skin for a few minutes and then put this on top of it. It gave me the perfect look that I wanted!

The texture of this feels good, and it has a good consistency. There was no discernible smell to me, and I am scent sensitive. If I only use a pea sized amount, this bottle will last a very long time making an excellent value.

title: Dr.Jart+ Premium BB Tinted Moisturizer with SPF 40 and Niacinamide | bb cream | Korean Skin Care

The niacinamide helps even out my skin tone, while the SPF 40 provides excellent protection against UV rays. The texture is lightweight and blends seamlessly, leaving my skin looking natural and brighter. It‚Äôs an all-in-one solution that simplifies my skincare routine. It didn‚Äôt clog my pores, and it didn‚Äôt give me that heavy feeling like some might in the summer months. I highly recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for an all-in-one BB.

title: Dr.Jart+ Premium BB Tinted Moisturizer with SPF 40 and Niacinamide | bb cream | Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
content:
This stuff is simply amazing. I've never used BB cream before so I wasn't sure what to expect. I have discoloring scars and liquid nearly liquid paper white skin (Half Irish, half Dutch) and it really evens out the color. I use just a tiny dab of regular concealer on the scar, apply this, and it's just gone.

I don't like wearing greasy sun block on my face so my usual go to solution is just to try and not be in the sun as much as possible. That's not really an option at this time of year though, so this stuff is the absolute next best thing for me. I know Vine Voice is supposed to be about helping other customers, but, they've made a customer out of me for this product as well. I will definitely be recommending it to friends and family going forward oo since it does the work of both sun block, minor concealing and foundation.

Just, as others have said, be aware of the color tint. If you're European descent like me you'll want to go as light as possible and hope for the best!

title: Dr.Jart+ Prejuvenation Firming Bakuchiol Cream for Preventative Aging | Anti Aging Face Cream | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024
content: I have requested a multitude of Dr.Jart+ cosmetics over the last few months and all of them have been quality products. This Bakuchiol Cream however has been my favorite. First of all, it is very thick upon application. It takes only a small amount to fully cover your face. It makes my face feel SUPER hydrated and coated in an after-shower layer of healing and rejuvenation. These things are hard to review based on effectiveness because its something that takes time and consistent use but I will say that it makes my skin feel great and I look forward to using it every night. The container is larger than necessary because of its aesthetics with a smaller container inside the bright purple container and a large metal lid. Perhaps they are trying to do something like SpoiledChild where you can replace just the smaller container inside and "reduce waste." Ideally, this would be a combination of bakuchiol and retinol for a well rounded anti aging cream however I know that some people prefer the natural elements that bakuchiol can provide. If you want a reasonably priced container of bakuchiol that will last you a few months (a little goes a long way) than I believe this is a great option!

title: Dr.Jart+ Prejuvenation Firming Bakuchiol Cream for Preventative Aging | Anti Aging Face Cream | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz

title: Dr.Jart+ Prejuvenation Firming Bakuchiol Serum for Preventative Aging | Anti Aging Serum | Korean Skin Care, 1.69 Fl Oz

That's when I discovered the anti-aging serum "Dr.Jart+ Prejuvenation Firming Bakuchiol Serum for Preventative Aging" and decided to give it a try.

This serum is based on Bakuchiol, a retinol-like ingredient that offers similar benefits without the side effects of retinol. I found that it effectively provides hydration and makes my skin's fine lines and wrinkles less noticeable, especially under my eyes. The serum is easy to apply, not sticky, and gets absorbed smoothly by my skin. It also pairs well with my current moisturizer.

I apply the serum once a day at night, similar to how I use Retinol-based serum.

I've only been using this product for a few days, but I'm happy to report that it's showing promising results. So far, so good!

content: If you know anything about Dr.Jart+ products, you know that they are well known for outstanding quality and effectiveness. This product is no exception. Therefore, I can't really speak to the bakuchiol's presence in this serum or its effects, since I haven't had the serum that long. What I can speak to, however, is the serum's efficacy in other areas. It is incredibly moisturizing, and can honestly act as a one-step routine since it's so hydrating and you don't necessarily need to follow it up with a moisturizer. title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution‚Ñ¢ Jelly Bear Lip Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Lip Mask Overnight Hydration | Korean Skin Care, 0.67 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
content: I loved the jar that this came in and I also appreciated the clean, fragrance free and tint free formula with this product. I have used and loved a lot of overnight lip masks. Compared to those other famous competing masks, I found that this product applies more like a thick balm to my lips and that was helpful at preventing my mask from rubbing off on my pillow or blanket overnight. My lips still feel like they have a layer of this mask on them in the morning, which I don't usually find to be the case. I like that this product has no tint that can rub off and stain my bedsheets. The value for this product is decent and comparable to other competing full sized lip masks. The only thing that I think could improve the product is possibly an applicator that allows you to apply the mask without dipping a finger into the pot.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution‚Ñ¢ Jelly Bear Lip Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Lip Mask Overnight Hydration | Korean Skin Care, 0.67 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
content:
I wanted to write this off as yet another lip gloss/balm, because that's what it seems like when you first use it. It's the kind of product you run your finger over a few times to "melt" and then apply to your lips. It doesn't melt as soft as other balms of this type, which is actually a good thing so you don't end up using too much product. It's not super thick or sticky and has no taste or smell. But it feels and looks like pretty much every other balm/gloss I've used.

The thing that got me, though, was the subtle realization that after applying it during the day my lips don't end up drier or flakier and I don't need to reapply it a ton of times during the day. When I used it at night, I noticed my lips stayed moisturized well into the next morning without needing another application. And the longer I use it, the better my lips feel. I definitely have NOT seen that with other lip glosses/balms. It absolutely delivers on the promise of intense hydration and smoother lips.

title: Dr.Jart+ Vital Hydra Solution‚Ñ¢ Jelly Bear Lip Mask with Hyaluronic Acid | Lip Mask Overnight Hydration | Korean Skin Care, 0.67 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
content:
This Jelly Bear Lip Mask is excellent!

Ease of application:
It arrived and has stayed in a semi-solid state... it doesn't really look like the product images but it doesn't affect the application. It's still very easy to swab with your finger or a lip applicator.

No sticky or tacky feel:
One thing I tend to hate about lip products like these is the gross tacky feel they leave behind. This lip mask doesn't do that!
It feels like a cross between vaseline and chapstick when being applied but quickly absorbs into your lips, so you're only left with a hydrated/dewy feel.

Plumping:
I have somewhat thin lips that seem to retreat into themselves even more when they're dry. This lip mask helps plump them to a healthy level, without making you look like you were stung by a bee.

Overall, this mask is a great option for anyone looking to keep their lips healthy and hydrated!

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin‚Ñ¢ Brightening Plumping Face Mask with Vitamin C | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
content:
This Dr. Jart+ Brightamin‚Ñ¢ Brightening Plumping Face Mask is quite nice! It's the first I've used where you activate the packet to soak the mask and then apply it. There are two compartments in the mask packet. On one side is the dry mask and on the other is the "essence" or liquid. You push the liquid to the dry side, massage it a bit, and then let the mask soak. This is an interesting mechanism that feels a bit more DIY than simply ripping open a package and unfolding a soaked mask. I like it!

One thing I don't like about the mask is the inclusion of YELLOW 5 (CI 19140) in the dry sheet and the inclusion of fragrance in the wet ingredients. The coloring added to the mask feels very unnecessary. It's just there to tint the dry sheet with a citrus design. The fragrance is not unpleasant, but I tend to choose beauty products without added artificial colors and fragrances whenever possible.

title: Dr.Jart+ Brightamin‚Ñ¢ Brightening Plumping Face Mask with Vitamin C | Korean Skin Care, 1 Pack

content:

- It has added fragrance which is not overpowering but still would have been nicer to have no added artificial fragrance.
- Other actually useful ingredients are glycerin, niacinamide, hyaluronic acid, and some fruit extracts.

title: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin‚Ñ¢ Under Eye Cream with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.5 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
content:
Item Name: Dr.Jart+ Ceramidin‚Ñ¢ Under Eye Cream with Ceramides | Korean Skin Care, 0.5 Fl Oz
Seller: Amazon.com
ASIN: B0DKXWDCKF
Cost: $42.00

So as I opened this I could tell this was thick high quality eye cream. I have occasionally used Ahava Extreme Firming Eye cream in the past and my wife uses it daily (retail $69.00 for .5 oz). So I decided to try Dr. jart+ cream and have been using this eye cream for about 10 days now. I think the results are similar to Ahava. I did no use the whole system just wash my face and apply the eye cream twice a day. I did not use the Serum toner nor Moisturizer. It‚Äôs super thick and creamy but absorbs in a few minutes but a leaves a nice protective barrier. It does have a slightly waxier feel after it is absorbed as compared to Ahava. You are supposed to dab an appropriate amount all around the eye area as needed. Pat until fully absorbed

Pros: Quality of the formulation. You can just tell the thickness of the cream. The way is goes on and absorbs so quickly.

Scent: I don‚Äôt like things with strong scents on my face and this perfect there barely any smell.

Nonreactive: a couple times I got carried away and put too much on and I never reacted, broke out or has any kind of adverse skin reaction.

Goes along way: This stuff is super concentrated like other high end eye creams so you only need a little.

Cons: It‚Äôs not cheap but its right in the range of high end firming eye creams. Maybe even on the value end of similar eye creams

Slightly waxier than Ahava. Once is fully absorbed it leaves a protective barrier and feels a little waxy when compared to the Ahava. But it's was likely intended to protect and keep moisture in. I did not see it nor notice it unless I rubbed my finger and was an ever so subtle difference between the two brands.

Conclusions: I was impressed and it compares well against Ahava extreme eye cream. Photos are from a 50+ person before and 10 days after. My wife use eye cream consistently and also like the product but honestly she likes what she uses and going to stick with it. I may add this to my long term routine. But If your already a regular eye cream user I am confident that this a quality product and works as well as other high end eye creams.

content: I am pleasantly pleased with this eye cream. It comes in a small, screw top jar and the appearance of the eye cream is thick. I just dabbed my finger gently on the surface, thinking it would be a thick cream but it has a more gel like consistency. Just a little bit of this product is needed to spread under and around my eyes. Very easy to spread and absorbed very quickly. This cream has a light, lovely scent that reminds me of lychee. No greasy or tight sensation in area after use. My under eye area was left feeling very soft but I haven't noticed much change in the puffiness yet. This cream is lightweight enough to go under makeup.
